title: Data Analyst
summary: Performs data analysis, quality assurance and quality control functions on data from various components of the wastewater collection system infrastructure, and stormwater system; including flow monitors, level monitors, automated control structures, rain gauges, pump stations, odor control and stormwater control facilities. Perform administrative functions to maintain the Electric Content Management (ECM) System. Organizes data and makes determinations and recommendations from information gathered through various data analysis processes. Regularly produces data outputs, including reports. Ensures that all data from the collection system is accurate and defendable before it is made available to our internal and external customers, including, but not limited to, Engineering, Watershed Programs, Maintenance Services, Ohio EPA, ODNR, USGS, and all of our member communities. Effectively communicates results and resolutions to all appropriate stakeholders. Performs other related duties of a similar nature as may be required.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Responsible for the daily administrative tasks for maintaining the Electronic Content Management (ECM) System application. Imports data, programs monitors, and configures sites and associated notifications. Actively researches and implements improvements to the data collection and stormwater infrastructure on a continuous basis. Manages technical projects from inception to final delivery. Ensures accurate documentation of data related QA/QC procedures. Identifies problems and recommends solutions through the evaluation and interpretation of data and trends from flow level monitors, rain gauges, automated regulators and pump stations. Tests process control systems for correct functioning and generates solutions to malfunctions. Reviews alarms, logs, system processes, and other operating data to ensure equipment is operating correctly and to identify developing solutions to problems and system improvements. Troubleshoots remote equipment problems with field crews. Decides a course of action in conjunction with the Stormwater and Sewer System Maintenance and Operation team. Continuously analyzes the Wastewater and Stormwater collection system and make recommendations for process improvements. Keeps appropriate stakeholders informed. Ascertains system performance from flow charts, drawings, and documents. Reviews specifications to ensure compatibility with current network environment. Builds queries using database tools. Creates automated reports, including dashboard reports for use in operation and maintenance decisions. Reviews contract documentation and specifications to ensure consistency and operability of instrumentation and controls. Maintains detailed records and develops and writes reports. Generates reports for internal use and for outside agencies. Interfaces with outside agencies when fulfilling data requests. Provides direction to appropriate parties on tasks or situations by providing clear information. Serves as a liaison between departments, managers, and other members of the team. Performs other duties of a similar nature as may be required.  Qualifications  MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS  EDUCATION Candidate must possess an Associate degree, preferably in Computer Science, Business Administration or a closely related field OR the candidate must have completed sufficient coursework toward a Bachelor degree, from a 4-year degree program, in a declared major within a related field. EXPERIENCE Candidate must possess five (5) years of experience in gathering, analyzing, troubleshooting, managing, and reporting data from multiple sources.  OTHER REQUIREMENTS  LICENSURE AND CERTIFICATIONS Candidate must possess a valid driver’s license with a driving record in accordance with the District’s acceptable guidelines. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Candidate must possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills; project management; multi-tasking, time management, organizational skills and attention to detail. Must be able to analyze technical data, predict outcomes based on information, and report findings to internal and external stakeholders. Proficiency in using the advanced functions of Access and Excel in the Microsoft Office Suite and experience in systems integration (communication and networking). Knowledge in process control and electronic instrumentation is highly desirable. Candidate must possess the ability to be reliable and punctual in reporting to work as scheduled. PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS Must be able to spend up to 30% of time outdoors in potentially contaminated, noisy, dirty, dark, and/or restricted space wearing eye and ear protection, and breathing apparatus.  NEORSD, an Equal Opportunity Employer The Northeast Ohio Regional Sewer District is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce, recognizing the full range of human differences and similarities. Through our unwavering efforts to leverage the potential of our diversity, we continually strive to build and foster an environment that respects each individual. We encourage and promote innovation, and provide opportunities for all employees to interact, communicate, and realize the full potential of their talents. Our Employee Benefits & Wellness Programs We offer a comprehensive employee benefits package including: Health Insurance Coverage, Various Retirement Planning Options (Ohio Public Employee Retirement System and Deferred Compensation Plans), Group and Voluntary Life Insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Assistance Program, Tuition Assistance Program, Free Parking at our facilities, Corporate Discounts, and More! We also have a very active Health & Wellness Program that promotes a life/work balance.  DISCLAIMER: The information outlined in this job description indicates the general nature and type of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not intended to provide a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities or competencies required of employees within this classification.

title: Analyst
summary: Allen & Gerritsen is seeking an Analyst to join our growing Analytics department. As the importance of understanding and utilizing marketing data increases, so does the demand for analysts. The Analyst will play a key role in managing, understanding, and generating insights from a multitude of data sources. Our ultimate goal is to help improve our client’s business with smart, data-backed thinking.  Responsibilities: Develop marketing analytics strategies for agency clients  Create marketing & business-centric analyses covering all communication channels  Design, conduct and interpret results of in-market tests  Consult with A&G clients and internal teams on analytically driven solutions  Work with a cross-functional team to identify marketing optimization opportunities, including insightful recommendations to improve performance  Organize and structure performance related data from a variety of sources (paid media, social platforms, web analytics solutions, 3rd party data providers)  Create reporting interfaces & dashboards to visually demonstrate performance  Generate data tracking strategies and implementation parameters  Maintain fluency in relevant analytics and interactive technologies  Effectively present analysis (verbal and written) for project teams and business leaders  Skills & Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Economics, Business, or Finance. Marketing Analytics specific programs is a plus.  1-2 years of professional experience in marketing analytics, media analysis (online or direct marketing), advertising or consulting.  Experience with analytics solutions including ad-serving platforms, search management technologies, web analytics solutions & social media platforms (i.e. Google Analytics, Adobe Marketing Suite, Kenshoo, DoubleClick)  Experience with one or more statistical analysis tools is a plus (i.e. SAS, R, SPSS, Stata)  Experience with data visualization software & tag management solutions a plus (i.e. Tableau, Domo, Tealium, Google Tag Manager)  Experience with one or more relational database management systems (RDMS) a plus (i.e. Oracle, MS SQL Server)  Experience with forecasting, predictive modeling & scenario planning is a plus  Experience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word  Inventive, intellectually curious and a creative thinker  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to prepare clear and concise client-ready documents  Demonstrated time management skills  Strong interpersonal skills. Must be able to work well in a dynamic team environment. Cultural fit is key.  Allen & Gerritsen (A&G) is a fiercely independent agency in the cities where independence was born, Boston & Philadelphia. Innovation & culture drive its success. A&G runs its own innovation think/make tank (A&G Labs), creates original entertainment through its production studio (A&G Entertainment), embeds brands into the cultural conversation through its Brand Newsroom and creates Brand Experiences that marry a brand’s physical and digital worlds to enhance consumer engagement. Ad Age twice has named A&G the Best Place to Work in U.S. Marketing & Media. To learn more, check out http://www.a-g.com/ or follow the agency on LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.  Allen & Gerritsen is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Unsolicited resumes from staffing agencies will not be accepted at this time.

title: Junior Data Scientist - Marketing
summary: Qualifications Undergraduate or advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (i.e. Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Operations Research) Strong academic qualifications, including advanced understanding/coursework in database management and math (Linear, Algebra, Calculus) 2-9 years of hands-on experience developing and applying predictive models and other advanced statistical approaches in a corporate or consulting setting, preferably in a marketing and sales context Proficiency in statistical data analysis and data mining packages (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, Alteryx, MatLab, STATA, Excel) Advanced knowledge of data management tools including SQL/RDBMS, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB), Hadoop and/or other big data technologies Advanced programming skills in at least one of Java, Python, R, C++, C#, etc. Experience linking multiple data platforms (social media, open, etc) and with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) Experience with digital analytics (Next Product to buy, cross channel attribution modeling, digital analytic tools, dynamic ecommerce pricing, etc). Intellectual curiosity, along with excellent problem-solving and quantitative skills, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes and recommend solutions Ability to independently own database development and decisions, balancing demands and deadlines Distinctive communications skills and ability to communicate technical content in an easy to understand way Strong people skills, team-orientation, and a professional attitude Willingness to travel up to 80% (Monday-Thursday)  Who You'll Work With You’ll work with our Consumer Marketing Analytics team in either Waltham (MA) or San Francisco. Our Consumer Marketing Analytics Center helps clients transform their marketing and sales by applying advanced analytics to generate value-creating insights from big data.   What You'll Do You will collaborate with colleagues and clients to create new strategies across a wide platform of projects, from customer life-cycle management, MROI, pricing and promotions, marketing mix modeling, to analytic transformation.   You will help to expand our current analytic capabilities and architect new strategies and applications within a dynamic innovative organization. You will shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and using that data in creative ways, and create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations, with an eye on optimizing every aspect of our clients’ marketing practices.   Through the measurement, manipulation, reporting and dissemination of broad sets of data, you will create valuable, transformative business strategies. You’ll apply and advise teams on the state-of-the-art advanced analytic and quantitative tools and modeling techniques in order to derive business insights, solve complex business problems and improve decisions.   As a core member of the consulting team, you’ll conduct deep analytics on a broad set of client and external data and play a lead role in team problem solving through findings and insights from that analysis.   You’ll also have the opportunity to lead and support the development of knowledge for our firm’s analytic group. You may do this by creating a roadmap for a greater understanding of analytics and its impact in the consulting population or by partnering with other analytic consultants to ensure timely and effective methods of the extraction, assembly and transfer of broad, complex sets of data.

title: Data Analyst, Advanced Analytics | Redmond/Seattle - Consultant
summary: About the role As part of a Big Data and Analytics project team, the Big Data Engineering Consultant focuses on building big data solutions using Azure cloud services to support data visualization and advanced analytics need for Avanade clients. This role helps with the design and development big data solutions using Azure PaaS Services. Participate in trainings to gain proficiency with design and development of modern big data and analytics solutions using Azure PaaS Services. Gather and document data requirements as part of the big data and advanced analytics team. Understand business objectives of analyses and document the same Undertake data analysis and collaborate with analytics team to shape data to meet data visualization needs Analyze, design and build Modern data solutions using Azure PaaS service to support visualization of data, including but not limited to Extract, Transform and Load data from Sources Systems to Azure Data Storage services using a combination of Azure Data Factory, T-SQL and U-SQL [Azure Data Lake Analytics] Data Ingestion to one or more Azure Services – (Azure Data Lake, Azure Storage, Azure SQL, Azure DW) Profile data and identify data quality issues. Collaborate with project team to identify options to address data quality and make appropriate recommendations Work with our Solution Architects to design big data architecture, develop data models, data shaping logic and validate with tools such as Excel and Power BI. About you You are an experienced technology professional with a passion for emerging technologies and a desire to innovate. You can work with cross-functional teams and diverse clients. You have knowledge in the common skills of database development including data models and SQL, report development and business intelligence terminology.  Your background and skills likely include: Demonstrable experience working with database, storage, collection and aggregation models, techniques and technologies, with the ability to apply such methods to solve business problems. Have a basic understanding of modeling and transforming data for reporting & data visualization needs using structured query language (SQL) and .Net programming languages such as VB, C# etc. Experience in structured problem-solving assignments. You enjoy tinkering, solving problems and building creative solutions. You likely have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, and/or Information Systems Qualifications Qualifications 1+ years' experience as a data analyst and/or engineer responsible for supporting the visualization team by performing analysis, designing and building data & reporting solutions. 1+ years’ experience with writing SQL queries to retrieve and analyze data form a database such as Oracle, SQL Server, MS Access, MySQL. 1+ years’ experience programming languages: C, C++, C# Experience of working with business users to gather, document and prioritize requirements Strong interpersonal and communications skills Experience in structured problem-solving assignments. About Avanade Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 27,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .  Requisition ID - 50148 Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.

title: Research & Insights Analyst
summary: The Research & Insights Analyst is responsible for conducting data analysis and highlighting key findings. The right candidate will demonstrate strong observational skills, have a clear interest in data and analytics, possess great attention to detail, and have a natural curiosity that drives them to find new and interesting ways to interpret data using analytic techniques and technology.   This role will be a key member of the PeopleMetrics Customer Experience team responsible for supporting the creation of clear, simple, and accurate outputs and deliverables that help clients plan actions to drive success of their initiatives. The Analyst will apply best practices in customer data analytics to optimize PeopleMetrics’ SaaS platform and support the Customer Experience team for both online and offline reporting. The position requires effective communication skills (both verbal and written), comfort with using technology, the ability to read data and make astute observations, and the passion to find the answers to complex questions and problems.   The Research & Insights Analyst will also work closely with the PeopleMetrics Operations team. This role will support the configuration of reporting and survey tools as part of the PeopleMetrics CEM implementation team where needed. They will also work closely with the team to transform insight reports into clear, easy-to-understand dashboards within the CEM SaaS application.   Candidates should be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. They should be as comfortable working alone as they are working as part of a team. A solid candidate will demonstrate aptitude for working in a process-driven culture, display a clear understanding of methods and approaches to analytics, and present themselves to the team as both a consultative and flexible teammate.   The Research & Insights Analyst is expected to:  Support Customer Experience efforts by organizing and cleaning data into manageable output that is easily interpreted by both internal and external clients.   Apply their keen eye for detail to Customer Experience reporting – both online and offline – to ensure that data presented to clients is completely accurate.   Demonstrate a clear understanding of data and the ability to explain data in a simple, concise way.   Assist in the configuration and setup of PeopleMetrics CEM programs where needed.   Support Research & Insights initiatives by aiding in the creation of report templates and documentation.   Be a vocal advocate for proper data practices for both internal and external customers.

title: Data Analyst
summary: Description: While working closely with the Clients, Requirements and development teams Data Analyst will provide technical solutions, identify approaches for capturing, storing, retrieving corporate data so that is may be used widely, effectively and as efficiently as possible. Analyze business requirements; develop high-level and detailed data assessment for complex, cross numerous business functional areas projects. Must be able to modify and create high complexity Logical Data Models and assist in ensuring optimum performance levels of databases in support of products and services.  Required Skills  Create high-level logical models that facilitate a cross-system view of data requirements for the large, complex projects.  Identify approaches for capturing, storing, maintaining and retrieving corporate data  Serve as the Lead Data Analyst on multiple development efforts for large and complex projects  Direct the development efforts to ensure effective and efficient use of data resources  Lead design efforts for development and maintenance of the enterprise data repositories  Develop recommendations for migration of the existing systems data to consolidated enterprise data repositories  Lead data requirements clarification sessions with Clients, application development and other database analysts  Review the data structures and corresponding models produced by subordinate staff, ensuring the deliverables represent the consensus of subject matter experts and information requirements on the small and medium complexity projects  Lead the efforts to coordinate development projects pertaining to data analysis  Lead diverse individuals to come to agreement about the definition, representation and delivery of data  Lead data architecture sessions and promote integrated systems and controlled data redundancy.  Lead analysis and recommend solutions of the data access requirements, data sourcing and data storing  Required Experience  2+ years of work experience in a Data management position (or equivalent).  College degree in a software development discipline or equivalent work experience.  Must work effectively in a team environment  Must be able to manage multiple priorities and work well under stress  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Must be able to guide junior level data analysts in their work effort  Must possess adequate leadership skills in order to lead and facilitate data analysis, architecture, design and enhancements efforts.  Excellent planning, customer service and analytical skills  Knowledge of the financial/investment and related business disciplines are preferred

title: Data Analyst
summary: Location: Reston, VA or Washington, DC or Quantico VA or Colorado Springs, CO  Start Date: Immediately  Who YOU are: As a future Data Analyst at Plus3 IT Systems, you: Are passionate about working on cutting edge, high profile projects and are motivated by delivering solutions on an aggressive schedule Aren’t satisfied with status quo, are insatiably curious, and regularly look for creative ways to solve problems and help your team meet commitments Love learning new technologies and sharing them with your team Have a keen interest in using any and all appropriate tools, especially Cloud-based and Open Sourced, to solve the problem at hand Have strong verbal and written communication skills, due to the dynamic nature of collaborations with customers, vendors, and other engineering teams to solve complex business problems together Use your experience and leadership skills to motive your teammates to deliver high quality results in a fast-paced work environment Structured thinker with passion for analyzing results and digging deeper Disciplined self-starter with strong attention to detail and advanced analytical and problem-solving skills Strong communicator, critical and creative thinker  What you’ll be doing: Produces timely and accurate analyses at the appropriate level of detail to enable business decisions Clearly presents and communicates information to customer to support decision-making Connect with business and mission stakeholders to focus and prioritize the customer’s analytics agenda to align with overall strategy and business/mission goals Collaborate within other business/mission intelligence teams to enhance the quality and value of team deliverables Connect with business and mission stakeholders to ensure all reporting requirements, report delivery and overall performance requirements are met Provide analytic requirements to design and implementation teams to ensure the development of the appropriate data environments to support the necessary data analytic requirements Identify, retrieve, manipulate, relate and/or exploit multiple structured and ustructured data sets from various sources  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree and 6-12 years’ experience, Minimum 5 years’ experience working on complex data/database projects Active Top Secret Clearance required with ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance  Desired Technical Skills and Competencies: Technical skills in Excel, ERP, Databases and Data Visualization. Intellectual capacity to digest complex information, see trends and analysis through data and to translate this into concrete actions Understanding of data ontologies and ontology-based data integration Knowledge and understanding of data storage and indexing tools, such as Hadoop, Solr, ElasticSearch, etc. Ability to utilize Unix scripting (Ruby, Perl, Python, shell) to automate data preparation and analytic tasks Ability to produce clear and concise documents and diagrams capturing data relationships, analytic procedures, and results using MS Visio, MS Excel and MS Word.

title: Data Analyst
summary: What you’ll do   You will be an integral member of our team profiling and mapping complex datasets, identifying and inspecting client data, and bridging the disciplines of our data science and software engineering teams. You will be directly interacting with machine learning models that assist in our clients’ daily business decisions. Put simply, you will work with all teams will operating at the intersection of databases, software and modeling to allow all teams to operate at maximum effectiveness.   Who you are   You are interested and excited about data modeling, software and databases. You’re looking for an opportunity to grow and challenge yourself on a growing team in a compelling industry. You’re looking for a crash course in anything and everything related to the field. You probably have some of what’s below but maybe not all (and that’s OK):   Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in relevant field (CS, Math or Stats preferred) Programming experience Resourcefulness, independence and analytical skill Willingness to learn new technologies and technique to improve Strong communication skills  Would be great but not required  Experience with predictive analytics, algorithms, or machine learning Experience with SQL Exposure to relational databases  Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities   The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

title: Data Analyst
summary: Join our Winning Data Services Team as a Data Analyst CARFAX products help millions of used car shoppers and thousands of car dealers. The Data Services Team transforms data from vetted sources into valuable information our customers trust. Are you an experienced Data Analyst looking for a new opportunity with a GREAT company? Do you have experience with complex research and analysis? Are you a strategic thinker and a strong problem solver? The Business Data Analyst role is important to the continued growth of the CARFAX Data Services Team. If the idea of working with billions of records to support CARFAX products sounds exciting, this may be the role for you! The CARFAX Culture Our culture offers the unique blend of a high achieving, high-energy workforce in a casual, laid back setting. Our employee focused culture has been recognized and earned CARFAX the honor of being named as one of the “Great Places to Work” 8 times in a row by Washingtonian magazine and additionally by the Washington Post, and nationally by Glassdoor! Are you ready to join a winning team, be inspired daily, and have a blast while doing it? If so, take a detour from your daily grind and apply today!  A typical day will have you: Doing complex research and analysis to support business initiatives, projects, and products Working collaboratively with cross functional groups to define business requirements Demonstrating your areas of expertise by identifying data abnormalities and providing insight Working with internal and external customers to extract maximum value from data Deriving, documenting, and communicating analytical business requirements Working with the development teams to determine long term sustainable technical solutions Communicating with stakeholders throughout the lifecycle of the project Providing business and technical expertise for overall analytics Summarizing and presenting analytical findings to a wide range of audiences Highlighting opportunities for product and processes improvements to reach maximum optimization Collaborating with team members to solve problems and gain perspective Serving as the account managers for a variety of partners; performing routine tasks to support accounts  You’ll need: A minimum of 5-7 years of direct experience performing data analytics Advanced EXCEL skills Experience in writing SQL queries A positive, can do attitude for new challenges in an environment with competing priorities Knowledge of SPSS, SAS, or R ( strong R studio skills a significant plus ) Strong problem-solving, analytical, and support skills; you’re a strategic thinker A keen eye for quality; detail oriented An aptitude to explore innovative ways to analyze data Experience in effectively communicating analysis and insight to all levels of the organization An appetite for continuous learning and confidence to challenge the status quo Strong verbal and written communication skills, emphasizing technical writing Bachelor’s degree required About CARFAX: You may know CARFAX as the company that’s provided trusted vehicle information reports for over 30+ years, but we’re so much more! CARFAX is on a mission to help millions of people shop for, buy, own, and sell used cars with more confidence. To do this we’re constantly expanding our offerings and stretching into new areas in order to provide needed, trusted assistance to consumers at all points of the car buying, ownership, and selling lifecycle. At CARFAX, we invest in the growth of our employees and offer rewarding, creative, fast-paced work, as well as many other opportunities to challenge you in your career

title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist
summary: The Academic Decision Support office at Virginia Tech is looking for creative and passionate data professionals in multiple roles to help develop and operationalize the data and analytical solutions that help decision makers at all levels of the institution gain necessary insights to improve services, processes, student and faculty experience, institutional effectiveness, and financial, human and facilities resource management. We are looking for professionals who are   • Passionate about data and numbers  • Innately curious and fast learners  • Self-motivated, team players with a drive to get things done.   Responsibilities   • Design, develop, and operationalize quantitative solutions that provide actionable insights required for institutional decision making  • Drive the collection of new data and refine, process, and integrate existing data sources  • Perform data analysis, develop insights, and effectively communicate the results to the stakeholders  • Develop a deep expertise in particular areas of the institution’s operations and serve as data liaison for Vice Presidents/Vice Provosts or other administrators directly responsible for those program areas. These areas may include but are not limited to: research, undergraduate and graduate education, learning outcomes, faculty affairs, libraries, career placement services, and each in collaboration with corresponding domain experts   Required Qualifications:  • BS in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, Finance, Public Administration, Public Policy or other quantitative disciplines  • Good understanding of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms  • Hands on experience in collecting, integrating, processing, and analyzing data  • Strong programming skills in Python, SAS or R, SQL  • Knowledge of open source or commercial data visualization libraries/tools  • Ability to think creatively, and solve problems  • Ability to work in highly collaborative and dynamic work environment  • Effective communication skills   Preferred Qualifications:  • MS in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, Finance, Public Administration, Public Policy or other quantitative disciplines  • Experience in applying a broad range of quantitative techniques (statistical modeling, machine learning…) to solve real world problems  • Experience in data collection, integration, processing and analysis  • Proficiency in Python, SAS or R  • Experience in working with relational databases and proficiency in SQL scripting  • Experience with open source or commercial data visualization tools/libraries such as Bokeh, Highcharts, Chart.js, Plot.ly, Tableau etc.  • Experience with cloud computing with exposure to big data technologies (Hadoop/S3, Spark, Hive)   Employment Conditions:   Must have a conviction check:  Yes   Describe Other:   Employment Comments:   How to Apply for this Job:  Qualified applicants must electronically submit online application, cover letter, resume/curriculum vitae and a list of 3 professional references to jobs.vt.edu. Apply to posting AP0170321. Applicant screening will continue until the position is filled. Virginia Tech is committed to building a culturally diverse faculty and strongly encourages applications from women and minorities.   Employee Category:  Administrative and Professional Faculty   Appointment Type:  Regular   If restricted or temporary, enter end date:   FLSA Status:  Exempt: Not eligible for overtime   Tenure Status:  Non-Tenure Track   Academic Year or Calendar Year:  Calendar Year   Percent Employment:  Full-time   If part time, enter Percent Time:   Pay Range:  Commensurate with Experience   Location:  Blacksburg   Department:  Academic Decision Support Services   Location, if not Blacksburg:   Location Zip Code:  24061   Work Schedule:  M-F 8-5   Job Posting Date:  12/14/2017   Review Begin Date:  01/10/2018   Job Close Date:   Restricted to university employees only?  No   Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Statement:  Virginia Tech does not discriminate against employees, students, or applicants on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, genetic information, or veteran status; or otherwise discriminate against employees or applicants who inquire about, discuss, or disclose their compensation or the compensation of other employees, or applicants; or any other basis protected by law.   For inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies, contact the executive director for Equity and Access at 540-231-2010 or Virginia Tech, North End Center, Suite 2300 (0318), 300 Turner St. NW, Blacksburg, VA 24061.   Reasonable Accommodation Statement:  If you are an individual with a disability and desire accommodation please contact the hiring department.

title: Data Analyst
summary: Job Description  The Data Analyst endeavors to work with enterprise users and data stewards to understand the analytics needs of the organization and building standard data models. Furthermore, ensuring that warehouse data is compliant, access control is appropriately maintained and that authorized users can bring a visualization tool to generate KPIs, dashboards and reports to support Spear business and Spear products. Definition and extension of a standard relational data model and analytics cubes for the Spear data warehouse, to support data from various sources and formats and to service the needs of both product analytics as well as internal Line of Business and enterprise Shared Services  Definition of data quality standards, data dictionaries and data mastering process to act as technical requirements of our data warehouse  Conduct full data life cycle analysis of data warehouse information to ensure visibility of enterprise data, proper data classification and protection of information correct role-based access to the information Assist in the consultation with internal business partners to assess needs and construct coherent technical requirements for new data warehouse needs and capabilities Qualifications  Required Experience:  4+ years of experience in data architecting, data mining, large-scale data modeling, and business requirements gathering/analysis. Hands on experience working with MySQL and Redshift SQL. Query and analyze large sets of data to draw conclusions and make recommendations to the business using statistical models and data mining techniques combined with business and operational knowledge. Works cross-functionally with other departments in troubleshooting and resolving any issues related to master data. Strong history delivering and discussing analytics outputs to non-technical end-users. Experience working with business stakeholders to solve complicated data-related problems by matching business. objectives with existing solutions, ad-hoc analytics and knowledge of what’s possible with more sophisticated data and analytics approaches. Strong knowledge on AWS environment (Redshift, Lambda, S3, EC2, VPC, Amazon API Gateway). Ability to deliver technical concepts to technical/non-technical persons, orally and in writing.  Preferred Qualifications:  Talend Data Integration experience. AWS Certifications preferred. Experience working with the Master Data Management methodology. 3+ years of experience working with an AWS Redshift and RDS environment. Experience creating dashboards utilizing an analytical platform such as Tableau, PowerBI, Domo, etc.  Additional Information  EEO  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Data Analyst
summary: DATA ANALYST  Consistently recognized for its growth, diversity and innovation, Triumph Enterprises is recruiting and hiring smart, strategic, and well-trained individuals with a 100% commitment to customer service. We currently have a need for a dynamic, self-directing and self-motivating individual to serve in the position of Customer Solutions Team Member (CTSM): IT Business Analyst (Technical Lead), to provide systems analysis, process re-engineering and business process development support to the Department of Commerce, Office of Acquisition Management (OAM). Responsibilities Providing hands on support to the Commerce Acquisition Council through the provision of Systems Analysis Metrics development Data Discovery Business Process mapping and Process improvement Support for programs and initiatives as commissioned and supported by the Council Administrative support to the Acquisition Council for initiatives like: CPARS/PPIRS Monitoring- UNSPSC - Cost to Spend Analysis Business Process Improvement Data Quality Support determination of operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats. Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends. Provide analytical support in areas such as policy formulation or analysis, program evaluation and assessment, strategic and business planning, and operations research and analysis. Provide insight into the business or technical discipline under evaluation Develop and build excellent relationships with prospects, clients, and internal team members. Lead client calls and communications including the development of presentations, status reports, and requirements documents. Support the DOC-wide Functional Change Control and Data Standardization Board project that defines standardized acquisition standards and processes for all Department of Commerce acquisition systems. Qualifications / Requirements BA/BS Degree and minimum of 6 years’ experience providing Infrastructure and Acquisitions Systems support within the Federal Government. Experience may be used in lieu of degree. Systems Analysis experience, preferably with some financial/acquisition/grants focus Capable of undertaking Discovery efforts for purposes of Business Process Redesign Excellent written and oral communications skills Knowledge and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Visio and Project), relational database technologies, html & JavaScript. Must have basic SQL script writing experience using multiple relational DBMS platforms Systems support experience; basic acquisition knowledge helpful Ability to work independently with Client and off-site manager. Ability to adapt to constantly changing requirements; adapt behavior or work methods in response to new information, changing conditions, or unexpected obstacles--must be able to deal with ambiguity. Excellent, pro-active communication skills, both written and oral--must be able to express information and make convincing arguments to groups and individuals effectively, considering the audience and nature of the information. Demonstrated problem-solving ability as it relates to: anticipating, identifying, and diagnosing problems, determining accuracy and relevance of information, using sound judgment to generate and evaluate alternatives, select from alternative courses of action, make recommendations, and act from developed contingency plans. Proven experience working with customers to assess needs, provide assistance, resolve problems, and satisfy expectations. Ability to organize work, set priorities, and determine resource requirements as it relates to determining short- or long-term goals and strategies to achieve them, coordinating with other parts of the organization to accomplish goals and monitoring progress and evaluating outcomes. Ability to understand the significance of the client's organizational culture and support organizational standards Consistently develops and sustains cooperative working relationships and facilitates cooperation within the organization, with peers, with supervisors and most importantly with the client group, by fostering commitment, team spirit, pride and trust. Company Overview Founded in 2005, Triumph Enterprises, Inc. (Triumph) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Business. We are headquartered in McLean, Virginia. Triumph offers the federal Civilian and Defense markets personalized knowledge-based professional services. Our company provides world-class solutions leveraging the following core disciplines: Program Management Support Engineering Support Services Training and Exercise Support Services IT Security (Cyber Operations and Risk Management Services) Sustainment and Life Cycle Logistics Services Data Management and Analytical Services Our pursuit of excellence is driven by an emphasis on Client Focus, Integrity, Imagination, and Employee Engagement – the Core Values that motivate and inspire our leadership, business practices, and company culture.  Triumph participates in e-Verify. We provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee’s I-9 Form to confirm work authorization. Triumph is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other status defined by law. Go to www.triumph-enterprises.com to learn more about Triumph.

title: Data Analyst
summary: Overview MAR Division of Oasis Systems has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to support the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) in Washington, DC. The contractor shall provide support in data analytics, data mining, large data manipulation, data exploration, data visualization and use of data analytic tools including descriptive, prescriptive, predictive analytics. Activities which the contractor may be tasked to perform include requirements analysis, system and database design, software development, testing, documentation, maintenance and production operations.   LOCATION: Washington, DC SECURITY CLEARANCE: Ability to pass a Special Agreement Check (SAC) and a National Agency Check and Inquires (NACI) Background Investigation JOB STATUS: Full-Time    RESPONSIBILITIES: Under this task order the contractor shall: Work closely with the customer to gather and document project requirements. Perform data analysis to learn/understand the data and the question being answered. Independent research may be required to facilitate understanding. Perform data processing to manipulate the data to ready it for reporting or visualizations. Manipulation may involve standardizing the data, filtering the data, supplementing the data with reference data, linking the data to other data sources and/or formatting the data. This task may require data modelling skills and the use of intermediary tables to store the cleansed/manipulated data set. Create data reports and/or visualizations to present the data in ways that are meaningful, actionable and understandable to the customer. This tasks includes the use of charts, graphs, pivot tables, drill down reports, etc., to present the information. Test each project thoroughly before presenting it to the task order project manager for quality control. Document test results as part of the project closeout documentation. Create user document and project close out documentation. Host project close out meeting with the COR, customer and contract project manager to present documentation and to demo the final analytics. Create documentation as required under the PMLC and the Configuration Change Board (CCB) in order to move projects to the production environment. Coordinate with internal and external organizations providing data to understand and resolve improper data formatting and other integration issues. When using SAS to create analytics, create and maintain customized SAS stored processes and SAS Macro libraries. Participate in facilitated meetings between stakeholders at CFTC which may include regular status meetings, user acceptance testing meetings and ad hoc development discussions. Data analysis tasks may be varied. They will include complex data requests that require data mining, extraction, and query optimization services from Divisions throughout the CFTC. Perform risk analysis which may include a broad range of risk measures, (such as Value at Risk (VaR): computation and evaluation, VaR tracking (VaR evolution over time), Incremental (and marginal) VaR calculation for individual asset classes /positions, conditional VaR, stress testing). Assist business users, economists, statisticians, and others, as required, to support effective use of analytic techniques and CFTC-approved tools. As necessary, develop prototype procedures as well as design database tables, queries and views in MS SQL Server. Should the COR determine that the prototype should be enhanced to perform additional functionality or made available for a larger number of users. Conduct performance tuning and troubleshooting on data analytic packages such as SAS stored processes. quality control. Document test results as part of the project closeout documentation. Work in conjunction with CFTC staff as components are moved into production and ensure ongoing smooth operations. Adhere to problem solution procedures and implementation procedures including the CCB process and updating Configuration Management Information System (CMIS). Analytics programs will require periodic fixes, enhancements and upgrades after moving into production. Operations and maintenance responsibilities may be transitioned to other teams in ODT. The contractor will be responsible for documentation and training needed for the other team to successfully accept the new work.  QUALIFICATIONS: The ideal candidate will have: A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience.  MAR Division of Oasis Systems is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of any legally protected characteristic including, but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, marital status, gender, sexual orientation, ancestry, age, medical condition, military veteran status or on the basis of physical handicap which, with reasonable accommodation, render the application to satisfactorily perform the job available.

title: Data Analyst
summary: RESPONSIBILITIES  Are you looking to make a difference in the federal government? Are you looking for a career, not just a “job”? Are you passionate about doing what’s right? Do you have experience and skills in acquisition, specifically information technology acquisitions? Then we have a position for you!  Noblis is seeking a Data Analyst to plan, analyze and report findings as they relate to marketing, operational and other business related questions. This opportunity supports a government agency with analysis to help them understand operations and make business decisions. Responsibilities include: data extraction; data cleaning; data analysis; statistical analysis; technical writing; and communicating findings. As part of a Noblis team, candidates will work closely with government clients to understand current issues and challenges, implement practical and effective solutions and foster the clear understanding of analysis results.  QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 5-10 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst; or 3-5 years of professional experience with a related Masters degree. Ability to extract data from a variety of systems utilizing SQL and Javascript Experience performing analysis of data through use of mathematical algorithms, sortations, tools and techniques Ability to validate findings and check ones own work Ability to generate reports that clearly communicate findings and considers stakeholder feedback Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint required Excellent multi-tasking and time management skills Experience analyzing operational data in the area of Marketing, Production, or Financial organizations Analyze and interpret results utilizing standard tools and techniques Pinpoint trends, correlations and patterns in complicated data sets Support the client or project manager in additional initiatives providing solutions to a variety of problems that may arise in an expeditious, efficient, and timely manner Preferred Qualifications Experience utilizing statistical techniques to analyze data Experience writing basic commands to extract data Ability to help visualize the data for analysis and to display results Demonstrated experience in data analysis techniques Proficiency with analytical tools, approaches and algorithms Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills. Proven results-oriented problem solving abilities. Facility with presentation graphics and/or spreadsheet tools highly desirable. Ability to work in a dynamic team-oriented environment, demonstrate teamwork and initiative, and function productively in a dynamic work environment. OVERVIEW  Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiaries, Noblis ESI and Noblis NSP, are solving difficult problems that help our government and our country. We bring the best of scientific thought, management, and engineering expertise with a reputation for independence and objectivity. We support a wide range of government and industry clients in the areas of national security, intelligence, transportation, healthcare, environmental sustainability, and enterprise engineering. Learn more at noblis.org/about.  Why work at a Noblis company? Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public.  Noblis has won numerous workplace awards. Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race.

title: Data Analyst
summary: Help CGI develop the next generation of mission-enabling applications for one of our federal clients. We are seeking Data Analysts to support our Federal Regulatory Business Unit in the DC metro area. Our team is focused on delivering results. Be a part of our industry leading team, delivering measurable business value to our client through technology solutions focused on their business needs. We are looking for people with deep financial industry expertise, analytical capabilities and an innovative mindset to solve problems.   Your future duties and responsibilities:  Connect the data to the business processes  , data mapping, data ingestion and ETL process development   Collect and validate the existing data architecture; validate the new data architecture.   Evaluate data quality   Identify opportunities for efficiencies in work process and innovative approaches to completing scope of work   Participate in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues   Conduct relevant research, data analysis, and create reports   Required qualifications to be successful in this role:  Bachelors or Advanced degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Finance or other technical disciplines   3-5 years of relevant consulting or industry experience   Proficient working with Oracle database, Relational Database, Unstructured Data   Dimensional DB's, data warehousing, data lakes, datamarts   Data Management Plans   Strong PL/SQL and DB2 SQL skills   Metadata collection and documentation   Data Analysis   ER Studio   Functional Requirements to design   US citizenship or Permanent Resident with the ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Clearance required   Preferred:   Statistical background ; familiarity with data requirements for analytical research and model execution  Proficient in SAS reporting tools  Proficient in R, and Python   Exceptional attention to detail and proven ability to identify process improvement opportunities   What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.   It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.   At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.   Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.   Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.   No unsolicited agency referrals please.   CGI is an equal opportunity employer.   Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, gender Identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, or other status protected by law. CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGIs legal duty to furnish information.   Skills: Data Analysis PL/SQL SAS  Have you been referred by a CGI Member for this position?* Yes No

title: Data Analyst
summary: Clearance Level: DoD Top Secret   Desired Education: Bachelor's Degree   Travel Requirements: Less than 10%   Position Description   Technica Corporation is seeking a Data Analyst to interpret results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.   Job Duties and Responsibilities:  Designs, develops, implements and maintains business solutions Works directly with clients and project and business leaders to identify analytical  requirements Review data loaded into the data warehouse for accuracy Recommend maintenance enhancements to data acquisition processes to improve  accuracy of data warehouse data  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Active Top Secret Clearance BS degree in math, science, statistics computer science or a related field 5-10 years of experience in information technology with an emphasis on computer, or information science or applied mathematics 1+ year of experience with Informatica Software Multiple Information Technology certifications are preferred  About Technica:   At Technica Corporation, our goal is to provide exceptional professional services and innovative technology solutions that meet or exceed our customer’s expectations. We specialize in a wide range of advanced information technology solutions from Systems Engineering to Information Assurance, and from Software Development to Product Solutions. From our locations across the DC Metro area, we provide technological subject matter expertise, program management and business process knowledge as a trusted advisor in support of our Department of Defense and other federal agency customers.   The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
summary: Data Analyst – Business Intelligence Analyst I   We are looking for a Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. This position will lead to career opportunities in Business Intelligence, Finance, Marketing or other disciplines within the business. Activities will include analyzing the business needs of the organization and related stakeholders to help identify and propose solutions, supporting all areas of organization with reporting and monitoring of key performance metrics, project team activities working in cross-functional teams. This position exists within a team of experienced associates who provide strategy and tactical analysis to the organization. The candidate will identify business needs, gather requirements, develop analysis, and provide reporting and recommendations.   Responsibilities  Solve organizational information problems and requirements by analyzing data; initial design and development; recommending system controls and protocols. Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs Acquire data from multiple primary or secondary data sources Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Support all areas of the organization including but not limited to Accounting, Supply Services, Marketing, Sales, and Operations. Document Processes  Requirements  Expert level MS Excel 2+ years as a Data Analyst Experience creating MS Access queries, report writing, and presenting findings Query exposure in various applications (Microsoft Excel & Access, Cognos preferred) Knowledge and exposure with reporting packages, databases (SQL, Microsoft Access), programming a plus (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics preferred

title: Population Health Analyst
summary: Reporting to and working collaboratively with the AVP of Student Health, the Population Health Analyst will conduct relevant data and analyses, research, evaluations, and assessments to inform strategic and tactical planning for the implementation of best practices in population health with the end-goal of improving student health outcomes at the University. The incumbent will also support the AVP in developing program or policy proposals and designing and implementing programs and services that enhance the Student Health Center’s community health initiatives.   Qualifications Required Education:  Bachelor’s degree   Preferred Education:  Master's degree in public health, health policy, health care administration, public administration or related field preferred   Required Experience:  2 years’ experience in data mining and data analytics work, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.   Preferred Experience:  Experience in public health, health policy, community health, or public administration   Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:  Strong critical thinking, reasoning, analytical and statistical skills, including proficiency in manipulating and analyzing data using sophisticated statistical software (such as SAS/SPSS) and extrapolate meaningful insights. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present findings from data analysis concisely and effectively to a wide range of audiences and through a variety of mediums. Strong attention to detail. Ability to research, review and analyze key external trends and influences from a wide range of information used to support the development of population health strategies. Demonstrated ability to work proactively, independently, and to maintain accountability for one’s work product.   Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:  Knowledge of population health; concepts of community health; and social determinants of health.   Additional Information EOE/AA/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Analytics - Analyst

and Mining External Data Enhancement Assists in determining quantitative methods for solving client issues Assist in presenting ideas and findings to future and existing clients Proactive and to address the risk/constraints Lead a team to complete large complex analytical project end to end Creation of best practices, case studies and training class materials should be encouraged preferred Experience with Tableau preferred Excellent written and oral presentation skills Ability to explain/present complicated/advanced analytical methodology and results to non-technical audiences but not limited to modeling, segmentation, DOE, forecasting, etc.) and create meaningful analytical outputs Ability to identify areas for statistical innovation or process improvement, do independent research, develop innovative approaches or processes/codes to 1) improve client business results, 2) improve efficiencies, 3) reduce potential errors Ability to translate analysis insights into actionable recommendations and strategies for digital marketers Ability to create robust analytics solutions to optimize digital marketing  Experience :  Must have experience with modeling and statistical concepts Experiences with applying statistical techniques such as regression, ANOVA, cluster analysis, factor analysis, time series forecasting, experimental and design, etc. to solve specific digital area.
