title: Database Analyst & Report Writer
summary: Structure  The Database Analyst & Report Writer is an exempt (salaried) position employed by the University of Cincinnati Foundation (UCF) and reports to the Director of Reporting Services.   Focus  The Foundation is heavily dependent on the information systems and data which support the fundraising priorities of the institution. The ability to retrieve data accurately and in a timely manner is of primary importance to efficient operations. The Database Analyst & Report Writer is responsible for working with the UC Foundation and the UC Health IT teams to extract and report on data derived from multiple data sources. This position serves as a data expert and is the coordinator of day-to-day methods used to retrieve data and generate reports. The position provides a link between raw enterprise data and the functional teams by aiding our internal customers in the retrieval of data. The position aids customers to quickly and accurately retrieve data for decision-making and fundraising initiatives.   Requirements  A Bachelor’s degree with at least 2 years of experience with database systems preferred Ability to work in a changing and team environment Must have experience with database development, SQL and SSRS .Net development experience is highly preferred Experience with fund raising and higher education preferred Experience with Blackbaud products highly preferred Must possess strong analytical and problem solving skills, effective communication and documentation skills You are a data aficionado – you love to analyze it, help structure it, manipulate it, interpret it, and knowing when it means absolutely nothing  Exceptional candidates should view full position description and apply online .

title: Data Scientist
summary: SAS believes in the whole employee experience. Meaningful work. Empowerment to make a difference that changes people’s lives. Dynamic work environments that foster innovation. And an award-winning culture that makes it all possible. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. Whether you're a university recruit, or an experienced professional ready for the next big challenge, SAS brings perks, passion, and the potential to grow. No limits.  Data invades every aspect of our lives, from the purchases we make, to the websites we visit, and the technology we use. At SAS, we not only develop analytical software, but use this software along with the vast data available to support internal decision-making, predict future activities, and empower SAS internally to operate at its best. As a Data Scientist on the Enterprise Analytics Team, you will be a pivotal part of SAS’ internal analytics programs. You will facilitate and develop strategic analytics roadmaps to support SAS’ key objectives using aspects of data/technology, analytics, processes, and people. You will partner with SAS leadership to translate critical business needs into creative analytics opportunities, both short and long term. Finally, you will manipulate data, develop analytical models, and construct action-driven analytics dashboards using the power of SAS technology. This role will have the opportunity to not only develop models, but recommend analytics projects based on communicated business needs, timelines, and long-term business and analytics strategies.  The Enterprise Analytics team utilizes the latest SAS products and interacts with internal SAS organizations to provide analytical insights empowering data-driven decisions. Team members are engaged in advanced analytical initiatives for HR Analytics, Customer Analytics, and IT Analytics. As a member of this team you would have the opportunity to assist from the project discovery to the data analysis phase and the final visualization and conclusion phase.  Qualifications Essential: Master's degree in statistics, analytics, data science, applied mathematics, or a related analytical field 3-5 years of practical experience building analytical models (text analytics, predictive models, etc.). Ability to construct creative short term analytical solutions to meet time-sensitive business needs with long term objectives in mind Programming skills with knowledge of SAS, scripting languages, and the ability to manipulate large volumes of data Strong relationship building skills and ability to partner with technical teams, business stakeholders, and SAS leadership Strong facilitation skills Ability to communicate both verbally and in writing with people from a variety of technical backgrounds, including the ability to explain difficult analytical concepts in terms to business users will understand Equivalent combination of education, training, and relevant experience may be considered in place of the education requirement stated above.  Preferred: Experience analyzing and building statistical models utilizing HR or employee-related data. Experience articulating a vision and interacting with executive leadership Ability to deal with large volumes of transaction data in UNIX-based environments Experience with SAS® Enterprise Miner, SAS® Model Manager, and/or SAS® Text Miner Experience with SAS® Visual Analytics or SAS® Visual Statistics Ability to solve customers' complex business problems using innovative analytical processes and techniques Ability to work independently and with a team environment  Additional Information: To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. title: Data Analyst
summary: DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Candidate will serve as a teammate working with Department of Defense (DoD) and other agencies to provide technical support and strategic planning for initiatives related to the Joint Asset Movement Management System program (JAMMS). Primary duties are in support of the PMO and will include conducting research and analysis of data and information related to JAMMS and related systems. The candidate will also work with teammates to establish milestones for future implementation goals and objectives. The primary areas of responsibility for the Data Analyst include: data analysis and validation, strategic planning, database queries, data extrapolation and interpretation, statistical analysis, forecasting and trending, and report production including the development of professional-level graphs and charts. Other primary duties will include, but may not be limited to: Timely response to data requests to ensure program goals and objectives are achieved. Ability to mine data and other information from databases and other qualified sources. Review data and create reports to identify information pertinent to program goals and success. Provide solutions for issues identified during analysis for data inaccuracies. Provide trends and forecast gained from interpretations conducted during data analysis. Develop and coordinate implementation goals and timelines as required. Provide easily understood and/or consumable charts, graphs, tables and reports for functional users and leadership. Formulate and apply methods to develop and interpret information related to program objectives. Identify areas for improvement offering viable recommendations and assist in the creation of milestones as related to JAMMS and SPOT objectives. Provide reasonable corrective action plans for data discrepancies. Provide easily understood and/or consumable charts, graphs, tables and reports for functional subject matter experts and leadership. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Business or IT related field is strongly desired but not required. A minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience as defined above is required. Additional preferred experience includes supporting DoD Enterprise systems (SPOT or JAMMS desired), developing complex database queries and comprehension of technical literature.   SKILLS: Must be able to work independently and as part of a team Will be detail oriented and organized, with the ability to work on multiple projects at one time. Will possess excellent communication, organizational, writing and comprehensive skills with the ability to communicate professional verbally and in writing with internal and external customers and management. Demonstrate a strong working knowledge of MS Office Suite, primarily in Excel working pivot tables. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: While performing the duties of this job the employee is required to stand, walk, sit, and operate standard office equipment. May occasionally be required to lift up to 50 pounds. SECURITY CLEARANCE: Candidate must possess and be able to maintain an Active DoD Security Clearance at the level required.

title: DATA ANALYST
summary: The Data Analyst at ISSS is responsible for the accuracy of all data in iPenn and SEVIS , to ensure a high level of data integrity and compliance, which includes data management, quality control, data cleanup, data integration, data analysis, and data matching with other Penn systems. This also includes analysis of automatic and manual processes that deliver data to identify issues and feasible improvements. Monitor alerts within SEVIS database or iPenn system, contact ISSS clients or correct the errors at the system level and distribute follow-up tasks to ISSS staff. Configure templates and automated workflows to handle varying possible combinations of incoming data. Move rule-based processing into automated workflows, in order to allow more ISSS staff time to be spent on more nuanced immigration issues. Analyze SEVIS reportable data from iPenn, Penn student records, and Penn HR records to identify and remediate gaps in reporting. Monitor and address batch errors to identify feasible process changes to reduce batch errors proactively and correct data integrity alerts within iPenn. Collaborate with ISSS team to identify the error cause and appropriate process adjustments to eliminate the issues. Generate fee processing reports to support internal fee charging processes, and support internal verification to ensure that fee revenue is properly received for all relevant ISSS processes. Generate routine and ad hoc reports to meet ISSS business needs and requirements from Penn community. Create and manage ISSS connection to Penn’s QlikView system and/or other data analysis software in order to present ISSS data to stakeholders in a more interactive format. Generate diagrams that illustrate the flow of specific data points among different systems and identify process points that cause problems and propose alternatives. Liaise with other central Penn units that handle international student/scholar/faculty processes, including student records/ NGSS project and HR records/ HCM project. The Data Analyst is responsible for clarifying existing processes and gaps, as well as matching existing data to propose and validate the potential of future process improvements.   Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of two years of data analyst experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Proficiency with databases and relational database design; advanced technical skills with SQL and Excel; excellent organizational, analytical, and problem solving skills; excellent oral and written communication skills; the ability to learn and work independently in a collaborative environment, apply new technologies and business rules quickly, and problem solving to propose technical solutions for reducing data/system redundancy and ensuring data integrity. U.S. Citizenship or legal permanent residency status as required by federal regulations.  DESIRED : Experience with database management and ColdFusion strongly desired; hands on experience with data visualization strongly desired. Demonstrated knowledge with SEVIS in F and J or employment based petition requirements; DSO / ARO , SEVIS and Sunapsis system experience; and cross-cultural or multi-cultural experience. title: Statistical Analyst Data Analytics-ISD
summary: Position Description Walmart Labs is seeking outstanding technologists for our Walmart Labs Retail Data Science team.  The mission of the Retail Data Science team: “WE ENGINEER SYSTEMS OF INTELLIGENCE AND ACTION TO AUTOMATE RETAIL DECISIONS AT SCALE”  The team creates value for Walmart customers through researching and building complex, cutting edge, and scalable algos, models, platforms, and technologies. The ideal leader will combine expertise in AI/ML/Open Source/Tech knowledge, hands-on experience in algorithm planning, engineering, strategic capability development in AI/ML, and imparting keen understanding of revenue models and value creation.  The successful candidate will join a dynamic group of scientists developing breakthrough capabilities in retail, creating new scientific approaches, and innovating solutions using state-of-the-art technology – at Walmart scale.  Analyzes data to drive analytics projects Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans Models compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity Participates in multiple analytics project teams Presents data insights to key stakeholders Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions  Minimum Qualifications  Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 3 years experience in an analytics related field, OR 5 years experience in analytics related field, OR a Masters degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 1 year experience in an analytics related field.  Additional Preferred Qualifications  3 years experience with SQL and relational databases (for example, DB2, Oracle, SQL Server). 3 years experience with statistical programming languages (for example, SAS, R). Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics and 4 years experience in an analytics related field. Certificate in business analytics, data mining, or statistical analysis. Master's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, or Mathematics.  Company Summary What started small, with a single discount store and the simple idea of selling more for less, has grown over the last 50 years into the largest retailer in the world. Today, nearly 260 million customers visit our more than 11,500 stores under 72 banners in 28 countries and e-commerce sites in 11 countries each week. With fiscal year 2016 revenue of $482.1 billion, Walmart employs 2.3 million associates worldwide – 1.5 million in the U.S. alone. It’s all part of our unwavering commitment to creating opportunities and bringing value to customers and communities around the world.

title: Data Scientist
summary: Reports to: Director, Sales Engineering  Location: New York, NY  Help shape the future of how people experience the digital world. You'll be at the forefront of an exciting shift in how companies use mobile data to attract, authenticate and engage their customers. And you'll be doing it all from our open-concept NoMad office stocked with plenty of snacks, a gourmet coffee machine and a fridge full of cold brews and vino for our team to enjoy.  We’re actively looking to add exceptional people to our team who align with how we envision ourselves culturally and professionally. As a lens to how outsiders see Payfone, you will represent a team of people who love what they do and who they work with.  Position Summary  The Data Scientist will work with large data sets and will derive client insights from that data. The ideal candidate will enjoy scouring data, conducting analyses and learning new data processing technologies. You will determine new ways to improve data and search quality and predictive capabilities. You will work closely with the Sales Engineering and Product teams and will be the go to person for data collection, analysis and client reporting.  The successful candidate will enjoy being able to solve problems without always having formal specifications. This is a great entry level opportunity for someone who is passionate about learning and willing to grow with our business.  Responsibilities  The Data Scientist will:  Analyze data for errors and inconsistencies Extract and transform data sets and provide insights for customer reporting Create methods for data handling and management for multiple projects at once  Education & Experience   Bachelor’s Degree Experience in data reporting, analysis and analytics Proficient in Javascript, Python, Java or high-level scripting languages Familiar with RESTful APIs, JSON, ETLs, and data manipulation  About Payfone  In today’s business world, a few bad actors can force businesses to treat all customers with suspicion. This leads to client and employee frustration, higher operating costs and lower revenue.  Payfone delivers seamless, non-intrusive verification using each mobile phone’s inherent identity to provide top-tier protection for businesses and their customers.  Remove friction and drive user engagement with Payfone Instant Trust. It’s the best way to enhance the customer experience while lowering risk, friction and fraud.  This position description should not be considered the final description of the position. It should be assumed that we would, to some extent, structure responsibilities in accordance with the successful candidate’s capabilities and changing business conditions.  Payfone is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people regardless of race, color, religion, gender or sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, veteran status or other personal characteristics.

title: Junior Analyst
summary: Designs marketing research projects and analyzes results by performing the following duties.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.   Assists manager in development of market research and sales objectives to help Concert Technologies meet its strategic goals.   Analyzes current research and statistical techniques, and evaluates the latest research developments to develop new sales and market research methods.   Establishes research method and designs means for collecting data for each project.   Researches external companies to develop sales and marketing campaign contact lists.   Develops and assists in analyzing customer purchasing patterns, preferences, and Concert Technologies' image and marketing effectiveness.   Researches sales and market conditions to determine market demand for existing and new products or services.   Gathers, analyzes, and compares competitor data and pricing.   Maintains market intelligence database and uses computer to examine, analyze, and compile statistical data.   Prepares reports, including charts and graphs, and presents recommendations for action plans to management.   Performs other duties as assigned.   Supervisory Responsibilities   This job has no supervisory responsibilities.   Competencies   To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:   Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.   Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions.   Verbal Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.   Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.   Motivation - Sets and achieves challenging goals; Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence; Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.   Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Develops realistic action plans.   Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.   Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.   Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   Education and/or Experience   One year certificate from college or technical school; or three to six months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.   Language Skills   Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of Concert Technologies.   Mathematical Skills   Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.   Reasoning Ability   Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, verbal, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.   Computer Skills   To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Internet software, Spreadsheet software, and Word Processing software.   Physical Demands   The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.   Work Environment   The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.   Employment Type   Part-time.   Primary Location   Concert Technologies Headquarters in Dulles, VA. title: Data Analyst
summary: Preferred Qualifications:   Experience using Raiser’s Edge. Experience with HTML, Java or Content Management System. Experience with visualization/analysis software. Experience in higher education and/or academic health sciences center. Experience in a large, complex organization and fast paced environment, managing multiple projects, and deadlines. Experience working with financial data.   Brief Description of Duties:   The Data Analyst is a professional and technical position that is passionate about data, keen to learn new methods to better report, access and manipulate data, and who thinks creatively about ways to expand current data management practices. The ideal data analyst will have experience working with large databases; designing developing, and enhancing technology solutions aimed at improving business processes and data management. The incumbent should possess the ability to think creatively and independently to solve problems and work with advancement staff in organizing data, creating/managing reports, and data analysis. The incumbent will use reports to aid business decisions supporting fundraising goals and resource deployment. The incumbent will be responsible for creating custom reports and data visualizations based on Advancement and SBF Business office needs and facilitate detailed data reviews and analysis.  Data Analysis: Provide program expertise to management to use in the evaluation of the Raiser's Edge (RE) data functionality and capability. Become fluent in all aspects of data coding, storage, reporting, extraction, sharing, and importing within RE. Look for ways to improve the use and overall integrity of the University constituent database including the evaluation of third party tools/utilities. Provide data analysis to a wide range of data sets to enable Advancement and the University to better understand the constituent data and improve donor/alumni outreach. Analyzes data and summarizes performance using summary statistical procedures. Develops and analyzes business performance reports and provides notations of performance deviations and anomalies. Create standard reports and data visualizations for the user community. Create and maintain complicated query selections and segmentations in support of user requests and management needs. Create custom reports using Tableau and other programs/utilities when needing more complex reports that are unavailable in RE. Develop methodologies for using data analytics tools; manage reporting, visualizations, dashboards and statistical graphs to illustrate findings. Test and debug utilities and reports to assure performance to specifications. Create and maintain data and system documentation as needed. Participate and provide technical assistance in special projects within Advancement and the Stony Brook Foundation. Data Management and Integrity: Ability to integrate multiple systems, data sets, query databases and perform statistical analysis; linking multiple/distinctive data set to provide new insights. Initiate and develop programs to coordinate the electronic selection and verification of data managed within the central data management system, Raiser's Edge; currently estimated at over 310,000 records. Regularly execute data cleansing routines and analyze results to fix problems on an immediate and go-forward basis. Develop reports and data validation process around key data metrics and business processes. Proactively identify opportunities for process and reporting efficiencies. Respond to ad-hoc requests from internal and external customers. Create and modify reports using Microsoft Excel, Microsoft SQL and other data aggregating tools. Collaborate with others to understand data opportunities, needs and drive data quality improvement. Operations Support: Work with Advancement staff to analyze and gather requirements to meet business needs and objectives, sharing the results appropriately. Report data needs to be analyzed to predict if the best tools are being used. Use Lumniate, Google Analytics, and any other data analysis tools to enhance the data understanding and needs. Automate processes to streamline work and minimize errors. Monitor data flow and seek out bad or misaligned data throughout RE and its associated systems. Monitor the use of the data through our Advancement partners (Annual Fund, Alumni Relations, etc…) and make recommendations for improvements and enhancements. (Non Essential) Other duties or projects as assigned as appropriate to rank and departmental mission. Special Notes:  This is a full time appointment. FLSA Exempt position, not eligible for the overtime provisions of the FLSA. Minimum salary threshold must be met to maintain FLSA exemption.   About Stony Brook:   Stony Brook University, home to many highly ranked graduate research programs, is located 60 miles from New York City on Long Island's scenic North Shore. Our 1,100-acre campus is home to 24,000 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral students and more than 13,500 faculty and staff. SBU is a comprehensive research-intensive university and a member of the prestigious Association of American Universities (AAU), which includes 34 public universities among its 62 members. SBU consists of 12 schools and colleges and a teaching hospital that provides state-of-the-art healthcare in the Long Island region. SBU also manages and performs joint research with Brookhaven National Laboratory, the only Department of Energy Laboratory in the Northeast, and shares doctoral programs with Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, a world-renowned molecular biology institute. Home to the Emerson String Quartet, the Jackson Pollack House in East Hampton, New York, the Humanities Institute, and the Southampton Arts Program, and with endeavors that extend to the Turkana Basin Institute in Kenya and the Ranomafana National Park in Madagascar, SBU sustains an international reputation that cuts across the arts, humanities, social sciences, and natural sciences.   Stony Brook University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer. We encourage protected veterans, individuals with disabilities, women and minorities to apply.   If you need a disability related accommodation, please call the University Human Resource Services Department at (631) 632- 6161 or the University Hospital Human Resources Department at (631) 444-4700. In accordance with the Title II Crime Awareness and Security Act, a copy of our crime statistics is available upon request by calling (631) 632- 6350. It can also be viewed on line at the University Police website at http://www.stonybrook.edu/police. title: Tableau Developer

title: Business Analyst Intern
summary: About Amazon  At Amazon, we have a unique culture built on pioneering into unknown and new frontiers. From selling books to creating the Kindle, from making films to launching faster delivery, Amazon reinvents normal. After selling the first book in 1995, we have grown at an incredible rate and now have become the universe’s most customer centric company. By hiring those that take risks and find fulfillment through making the impossible commonplace, Amazon cultivates innovation. Every employee at Amazon has the power to forge their own path and to have a true impact on the business, and we find that exhilarating.  Read more about us.   When we hire you at Amazon, we hire for the future. With unlimited career opportunities, Amazon invests in ensuring our teams are always challenged, constantly learning from each other, and creatively contributing to our next big idea. You will be surrounded by the best innovators of our time and we welcome you to make history with us: minority, female, gender identity, disability, or sexual orientation.  See why diversity is important to us.   Amazon Seller Support  Amazon’s Seller Support division acts as the primary interface between Amazon and our 3rd party Sellers. We obsess over providing world –class support to Merchants selling on the Amazon marketplace. We strive to predict Sellers’ needs before they recognize they may need our support, create innovative self-help tools, and provide solutions to help our business partners better serve their customers.   The Role  As a Business Analyst intern, the majority of your internship will be spent supporting a Business Analyst in Grand Forks, ND. In this role you will help to build reports and performance dashboards and drive analysis to communicate to stakeholders. During your internship you will dive into Standard Work and Continuous Improvement through an intern project.   Your key responsibilities may include (but are not limited to the following):  Investigating data sets for root cause and trend analysis. Creating and maintaining reports and dashboards for the business. Providing data to stakeholders to drive change and enhancements to procedures Identifying and documenting new sources of information.  Program Overview  Length of 12 weeks. Hours: 15-19 hours per week.  Basic Qualifications You are working towards a Bachelor’s degree in a Mathematics or Computer Science related field at the University of North Dakota. You have a minimum GPA of 3.0. You are authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.  Preferred Qualifications You have strong verbal and written communication skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Knowledge of databases and how to use SQL to extract data. Basic understanding of a computer language (Java, Python, C/C++). Strong multitasking skills needed to interact between multiple system applications quickly and efficiently. Organized and effective time management skills, with a high degree of flexibility. Strong enthusiasm and self-motivation.

title: Data Analyst
summary: NJM Insurance Group’s West Trenton location is seeking a Data Analyst. This position will participate in data requirement elicitation, analysis, mapping and testing activities for the business technology solutions efforts.   Job Responsibilities:  Develops and executes test plans and scenarios and identifies testing defects and issues. Represents department in cross department efforts and works collaboratively with cross functional business planning team to address departments’ data and reporting needs. Communicates project status and provides updates to department management. Evaluates and monitors department’s metrics and proactively documents trends with a detailed description of possible business impact. Ability to conduct data mapping activities in support of data projects. title: Sales Operations Analyst
summary: NVIDIA has continuously reinvented itself over two decades. Our invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing. Nvidia is a “learning machine” that constantly evolves by adapting to new opportunities that are hard to solve, that only we can pursue, and that matter to the world. This is our life’s work, to amplify human creativity and intelligence. Make the choice to join us today. We are looking for a Senior Sales Analyst. What you’ll be doing: In this role, you will partner with executive sales leaders and regional sales operations leaders to define, build and operationalize key processes. You will lead the effort to evolve NVIDIA's sales performance management processes and tools. Work with sales leaders to define key objectives for multiple sales roles. Provide guidance and direction to regional teams to ensure key objectives are consistently applied aligned to goals. Help develop regional sales targets and enhance tools to communicate to field. Provide decision support for matrixed Sales organization on industry coverage decisions. Work cross-functionally with key partners to build and design models to solve business problems and derive key business insights and recommendations from disparate data sets. What we need to see: Positive, high-energy attitude Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related disciplines. Master's degree preferred. 8+ years relevant work experience Tolerance for ambiguity, flexibility, and a willingness to implement ideas from others Ability to lead challenging work in a dynamic environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with quantitive, organizational, and analytical skills Ability to share concise conclusions, and then provide supporting analysis as needed Works well in matrixed teams Enjoys finding solutions to problems by being passionate, creative and tech savvy Excellent MS Office skills, especially Excel Ways to stand out from the crowd: An obvious passion for getting things done in fast-paced sales and technology environment Self-motivated, high EQ, can work within anyone from SVP to field sales Experience working internationally You're a self starter with a mindset for growth and continuous learning NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Product Manager
summary: As a pioneer in healthcare analytics, our goal has always been simple: strengthen the business of healthcare in order to improve care. Since 1994, we’ve been merging this single-minded focus with leading technologies and a multidimensional understanding of healthcare to become a leader in analytics driven performance management. We believe the future of healthcare lies in data. By combining sophisticated analytics with the know-how to act on them, MedeAnalytics helps you see the connections—between payer and provider, cost and quality, and good business and better healthcare.   Today, we provide enterprise-level solutions to over 1,500 clients in the US and UK, including ambulatory groups, hospitals, health systems, health plans, state Medicaid programs and more. Our solutions are delivered by a team of experts who bring an unmatched depth of knowledge and healthcare experience to every aspect of our engagements. With the industry’s leading cloud-based analytics platform, we have the powering our Client’s win-strategies across the healthcare spectrum!   For three consecutive years, we have been named as one of Modern Healthcare’s top 100 Best Places to Work in Healthcare for 2014, 2015 and 2016.   We are looking for an experienced and skilled Sales Leader for our Health Plan Services segment that will be responsible for driving our Payer sales team’s planning, strategy, and execution with a goal of meeting/exceeding sales growth budgets.   Current Role & Growth Opportunity:   Exercise your entrepreneurial spirit by taking ownership of key modules and products within the Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) product family and by maintaining product roadmap in an agile environment. Collaborating with internal stakeholders and clients to create and evaluate product concepts, plan roadmaps, generate product requirements, and steward them through the commercialization process to successfully deliver them to market.   This is a chance to be a part of a growing company and work on innovative, big-data products designed to lower the costs of healthcare in the US. The ideal candidate has product management experience and is excited about making products that help clients across the healthcare industry put action plans in place by harnessing the power of their data within a performance management tool.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Responsible for “Enterprise Performance Management” product strategy, product roadmap, and ongoing market research.   Managing the entire product or services lifecycle or from strategic planning to tactical activities.   Creating business cases including financial models to support the development of the product or services.   Establishing customer persona and market profiles.   Evaluating and making Buy/Build/Partner decisions on bringing solutions to market.   Specifying market problems and requirements for current and future products or services by conducting market analysis, supported by attending conferences, meetings with customers and prospects and key internal resources.   Defining and inputting features into agile project management software.   Work closely with Product Owners to ensure that market requriements for new initiatives are being properly developed.   Management of new products within assigned product family throughout the readiness process to ensure efficient market launch of new initiatives.   Ongoing assessment of entire product family and individual within product family.   Working to construct technology partnerships and contracts and maintainign existing partnerships that support our product offering.   Providing tactical support to other internal initiatives such as sales training, collateral development, and product performance.   Overseeing the commercialization process of initiatives to ensure that solutions are brought to market with appropriate readiness levels to sell, deliver and support effectively.   Essential Education and Experience:  Undergraduate degree   2 or more years of Product Management or Business Analyst experience   2 years+ related work experience in Healthcare software industry   Financial acumen is a key skill   Hands on experience with healthcare applications as a user or vendor is a plus.   Working knowledge of major clinical and healthcare software products, standards, and interfaces   Experience defining/prioritizing detailed product requirements   Ability to think strategically and execute ruthlessly, e.g., being able to articulate a long-term product vision and then roll up your sleeves to get things done   Ability to facilitate cross-functional teams, schedules and decisions   Ability to proactively monitor, analyze and resolve release dependencies, issues and risks   Strong written and verbal communication skills   Travel required: approximately 10-25%   Working Environment:   The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works near office equipment (telephone, computer) and other employees. The employee works in normal office conditions where there is no physical discomfort due to temperature, dust, noise, etc. Verbal and written communication, telephone usage, filing, sitting, typing, driving, reading and carrying required to perform the essential functions of this job.

title: Database Analyst
summary: Our story began over 25 years ago with a simple but revolutionary idea – to create the perfect cup of coffee. An industry pioneer, Nestlé Nespresso has become an international reference for the highest quality coffee and an iconic symbol of refined elegance. We are now in more than 50 countries and our team has grown well beyond 7,000 employees. We are part of Nestlé SA in Switzerland, the world's largest food company. Nespresso USA continues to drive momentum and innovation in our market segment, and in North America, we're just getting started.   Nestle Nespresso USA is searching for a driven, detail oriented, Database Analyst to lead deep dive analyses and advanced analytics projects to support database/CRM activation. This role will work closely with the CRM Insights Manager to develop and execute analytics plans including: promotional dashboards, big picture business analyses, and other vendor driven projects.   Responsibilities  -Act as primary point of contact for database related questions for internal and external stakeholders  -Drive database and technological advancements to improve level and efficiency of analyses as well as database hygiene  -Generate queries and in general leverage data to address key business questions  -Mine data for insights and key trends that address business questions and inform strategic decisions  - Deepen understanding of the Nespresso consumer through customer level analysis  - Drive omni channel strategy through holistic, cross-channel analyses  -Communicate key insights and recommendations to stakeholders  -Determine where predictive and attribution modeling will best enhance the businesses core competencies  -Work with CRM Insights Manager to develop a deployment plan and implementation of the model  -Review business objectives and key trends with CRM Insights Manager and other CRM counterparts to develop predictive model-based segmentation strategies  -Create personalized communication strategy that increases consumers’ engagement with the brand and lifetime value   REQUIREMENTS:  • Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in business, marketing, statistics, or computer science  • 4+ years of experience in an analytics focused role  • 2+ years of experience in direct to consumer marketing analytics  • Advanced SQL querying skills required  • Prior experience using data analysis tools required (SPSS, SAS, etc.)  • Prior experience using business intelligence tools strongly preferred (Cognos, SAP Business Objects, etc.)  • Prior experience using data visualization tools preferred (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)  • Strong analytical skills  • Ability to clearly deliver insights and findings  • Ability to integrate multiple data sources into a single narrative  • Strong strategic thinking skills  • Strong presentation skills

title: Data and Reporting Analyst
summary: Essential Functions: Prepare and submit timely and accurate data reports to bureaus and vendors to satisfy external reporting requirements in the U.S. and Canada. Work with leader to research applicability of new or updated reporting requirements. Develop and implement appropriate reporting processes. Interact frequently with statistical agencies and state bureaus to clarify instructions and understand changes. Examine reports for errors and apply corrections as needed. Maintain thorough and accurate process documentation. Work across teams to promote consistency in responses to external reporting requirements and help create a consistent and centralized approach. Provide accurate responses to internal ad-hoc data requests. Develop and implement reports and monitors to help teammates analyze product health and help answer business questions. Evaluate data integrity on an ongoing basis. Participate in cross team data management initiative to help improve the quality of company reporting. Help document business workflows with data impact and understand business reporting requirements. Assist with creation of data models and validation methods. Create and maintain appropriate documentation. Provide community training as needed. Participate in information-gathering phase of project lifecycle. Advise regarding data and reporting needs. Creative problem-solving skills with the ability to perform independently.  Experience building and/or maintaining databases, including reporting using SQL.  Experience managing large datasets and database management.  Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills in dealing with administrative/school-based personnel.  Ability to work under pressure and effectively prioritize in a demanding environment.  Interest and/or experience in education and public policy.  3+ years of experience in data management and analytics.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office software applications, especially Access and Excel.  Experience with Cognos, SAP, Oracle, or other business intelligence software systems.  Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as Google Apps Script, JavaScript, HTML5.  Experience with current state analysis, needs assessment, process mapping, and functional analysis. This group analyzes cross function business challenges in operational, financial, and market related problems using data analysis to improve operations and drive strategic efforts across the organization. title: Data Analyst
summary: Reputation.com is the leader in Online Reputation Management, and our mission is to sort through the vast amounts of information about our customers represented in surveys, reviews, and other sources and derive actionable insights and tangible business results for our customers.   As a Data Analyst you will be at the center of this mission. We want you to help us develop the best algorithms to extract insights from that corpus of customer feedback, build the best models to measure the value of those insights, and lead the way in creating data products out of these models.   Responsibilities You will be expected to be a key contributor to one or more of our core models as we take it end-to-end from understanding business needs, to problem formulation, to modeling, prototyping, and into production. You should be comfortable taking feedback from everyone – Product Managers, Engineers, customers, the CEO, etc. – to help understand business objectives and constraints and contribute at various levels to deliver the most powerful models and data products, as well as build and maintain a roadmap beyond v1. Qualifications Demonstrated ability to solve problems using data BS/BA degree in Data Science, Analytics, Operations Research, Statistics or a related field. Advanced degree in a related field and/or 1+ years of relevant industry experience. A strong background in machine learning, stochastic modeling, and predictive analytics, and/or experience building data products with these techniques. Experience with NLP/text analytics is a plus Strong communication skills. You are able to explain models intuitively to technical and non-technical audiences. Proficiency in Python, R, or similar and with related machine learning packages Proficient with SQL. Data visualization experience a plus. Strong programming skills and/or experience or a strong interest in cluster computing frameworks such as Apache Spark are a plus About Reputation.com :   Ninety percent of buyers say online reviews influence their purchasing decisions. A difference of one “star” in a rating leads to a 9 percent difference in revenue. Yet companies struggle to ensure that their reviews and ratings reflect actual customer satisfaction.   CMOs find themselves at the mercy of algorithms they don’t control on Google, Facebook and thousands of specialty sites – where no amount of marketing spend can offset the negative impact of a weak online reputation.   We deliver the category-leading Online Reputation Management (ORM) platform for large, multi-location enterprises. Our intelligent platform helps them:  · Monitor review sites and social media  · Generate more representative star ratings and reviews  · Make operational changes to improve customer experience  · Maximize customer retention and revenue   Reputation.com is a World Economic Forum Global Growth Company and is funded by the same top-tier venture capital firms that backed Google, Skype, Intuit and Microsoft.   We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
summary: Job Description: Kratos RT Logic has a broad set of integrated, strategic products with enterprise grade reliability. Our solutions touch just about everything across the ground segment. The enterprise products include the Monics family to protect the signal, Compass to monitor and control equipment, the NeuralStar family to manage network operations and assure quality of service. title: Apple Data Center Site Selection and Strategy Research Analyst
summary: As Apple's products and services scale the globe, the Data Center Affairs team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Apple's data center future. Apple’s Data Centers power Apple's online services, including the iTunes Store, App Store, iMessage, Maps, and Siri for customers across the globe. We work with competing demands to make sure we have the greenest, most efficient, and most cost effective data centers that support Apple’s growing and changing needs.  As part of the team, you will embody a unique combination of research capabilities, market knowledge, analytical skills, and strategic thinking. You will work with government agencies and internal teams to meet Apple’s needs for next generation data center sites worldwide. You will have strong research and analytical skills in the areas of data centers; tax environments, and political frameworks; energy and other utilities; telecommunications; and economic development incentives. In this team, you will have a key role in driving market analysis, site selection, and agreement negotiations for new and existing data centers and related infrastructure. Key Qualifications Responsibilities Research and maintain an up to date state of the market Champion the development of long-term, regional data center location strategies, taking into account existing and potential future sites, and working seamlessly across stakeholder teams to lead strategic corporate initiatives. Create, build, and manage business relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, including Apple project teams, and economic development and government officials Research available utility services, applicable economic development incentives, and fiber infrastructure. Presenting findings and strategy to senior management.  Description You will have substantial strategic analytical and research skills, in addition to rock-solid presentation and collaboration capabilities. You will be a superb, and proven Project Manager, adept at building broad stakeholder consensus and you will have a comfort level presenting to senior management. You will be a flexible, proactive team player who understands and seeks to support the larger strategic initiatives of the company. You work successfully across diverse circumstances, expectations, environments, cultures, paradigms, and technologies.  For a new team member to be effective, he or she needs to be comfortable doing research, strategizing, structuring and negotiating a range of mission-critical agreements in diverse settings and with diverse parties. This team excels when all team members are able to communicate effectively, build broad stakeholder consensus, and have a comfort level presenting to senior management.  Education Minimum Qualifications BA or BS degree in liberal arts, political science, English, communications, public administration, engineering, environmental science, finance or economics or equivalent practical experience. Combination of research capabilities, market knowledge, and strategic thinking Demonstrated ability to come up with commercially and technically creative solutions and comfort working independently and thinking dynamically, while still leading cross-functional strategic efforts. Be comfortable presenting findings and strategy to senior management  Preferred Qualifications MBA, JD or PhD Experience with corporate communications, government affairs, and public relations strategies. 5 years relevant work experience, including experience leading highly confidential location strategy and site selection initiatives for high-technology, industrial-scale projects (for example data centers, semiconductor fabrication plants, pharmaceutical/biotech facilities, manufacturing facilities), including experience with real estate evaluation, construction, utility contracts, economic development incentives, legislative initiatives, and taxation. Willing to travel 50% of the time. Familiarity with power transmission and distribution, telecommunications infrastructure, data center technology, and/or other related areas of technical expertise.

title: Data Scientist
summary: Who We Are Pixability is a video advertising technology company that gives media professionals the ability to plan, buy, and report across YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, and Spotify. Pixability’s holistic solution empowers advertisers to deliver outstanding campaign performance across these premium video environments, through deep insights, patented targeting technology, verified viewability, and apples-to-apples reporting. Pixability’s solution empowers advertisers to activate video at every stage in the consumer journey in order to deliver impactful business results.  Our Award-Winning Culture:  Emphasis on work/life balance - Seriousl In office massage therapist - No, seriously Unlimited Vacation - We probably should have put this first Group yoga and boxing - Get your zen on in & out of the ring Quarterly volunteering events - Giving back is good for the soul Weekly happy hours & catered lunches - Probably why we exercise Hackathons - Now's your chance to build that giant account-managing robot  The Role Pixability brings a data-driven, scientific approach to video marketing. We are at the forefront of this revolution and use large-scale data analysis to make video content more effective. Data Science plays an important part in that effort. We build models, tools, and platforms to convert our rich data into valuable insights for our customers.  As a Data Scientist you may extend models which select the most appropriate channels to run a video ad. You may build optimization solutions which determine the best bid level across a given campaign, across all social platforms. You might also build additional functionality into our AI bot. Whatever you work on, you will have a may impact on our solutions.  Who You Are Data drives you. You are motivated by having a significant impact on the company and creating differentiated solutions within the industry. You are comfortable exploring and working your way through ambiguity. You value collaborating with a team of researchers who encourage your success.  The Team At Pixability, the Data Science team is the research and development department. We build industry leading solutions which create significant competitive advantage for the company. Some of the problems we face have very amorphous scopes and require the team to embrace an experimentation and cooperation mindset. As such we rely on each others’ varying expertise to scope the problem into manageable, tractable, goals. Collaboration is a central tenant of the group, we plan together, execute independently and share with each other throughout the project. Therefore we value openness, transparency and accept the best idea, wherever it originates from.  What You Bring to the Party   Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, data science, information technology, economics, statistics, hard sciences, or related fields 1+ years experience in several of the following: Analysis tools such as Spark, R, scikit-learn, NumPy, or similar Algorithms and data structures for machine learning Statistical analysis methodologies Software development skills in Java or Python on UNIX/Linux SQL and NoSQL databases such as MySQL, Vertica, GreenPlum, Snowflake Demonstrable ability to analyze large data sets and provide compelling insights to technical and non-technical people General knowledge of online marketing, social media, SEO and Adwords is a big plus  Local candidates only please – no relocation is available for this position.  Pixability does not accept/pay fees for unsolicited resumes from third party agencies/vendors  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Pixability is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Data Analyst
summary: About the Data Analyst Position In this role you will be responsible for insuring the validity of the data in the PlanSource Benefits Administration System and proactively resolving any potential issues. summary: Occupational Summary As the Duke School of Medicine moves towards its vision of an integrated home for research combined with world class clinical care in a learning and evidence-based academic environment, the Department of Anesthesiology is positioning itself at the heart of these initiatives through the growth of its IT Solutions Team. The ideal candidate will facilitate, coordinate and monitor the design, implementation and maintenance of research databases for the Duke University Center for Translational Pain Medicine (CTPM) and serve as a liaison among clinical and analytic research users. Work Performed Design, implement and maintain databases for the Duke University Center for Translational Pain Medicine (CTPM) to include patient research data and specimens as well as legacy study materials. Prepare guidelines for use in all data automation efforts and establish common definition for each automated data element provided or used. Assist data users and applications development teams in planning efforts by advising them of data conventions and definitions. Resolve conflicts arising over the creation, control and use of data; develop and enforce data base use guidelines. Prepare interim and final reports on study datasets, including summary statistics of enrollment and other variables. Convert and upload datasets in formats useful for collaboration and public data sharing resources. Establish and maintain an index to all research data and provide information to users regarding location and accessibility of data; monitor requests for and creation of analytical datasets. Monitor database performance and serve as quality control agent for database use. Improve data models and refine ETL processes on a recurring interval. Provide consultation and training sessions to CTPM database users. Serve as a liaison to database vendors to ensure current training, equipment, conventions and updates are maintained. Ensure that external and internal regulations and policies governing data management are met including regulations concerning security, auditability and privacy. Provide initial authorizations to application developers on test data bases. Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.  Proficiency with SQL language. Experience with Microsoft SQL Server (preferred), Oracle database systems, or Postures / MySQL databases. Database design for large research datasets. Database ETL experience between large and complex systems. Prefer experience with lab and research software such as statistical programming in SAS and R, or LIMS specimen-tracking software. title: Product Quality Analyst
summary: (Menlo Park, CA) Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. The Product Quality Analytics Team is responsible for advancing Facebook's advertising business by identifying and collaborating with the product team to implement opportunities that improve the quality of existing and future products. With deep analytics expertise and understanding of the product health and the customer experience, the Product Quality Analytics Team partners with the product team (consists of Engineering, Product Management, Research, Design, etc.) to ensure we launch high quality and reliable products to the market. They reinforce that expertise by becoming fluent in the data around Facebook ads and developing a well-rounded knowledge of ad products and the ecosystem as a whole. Utilizing that critical expertise, we keep the customer experience at the center of our focus.    Product Quality Analysts are highly analytical, data driven, and scrappy- not only identifying impactful changes Facebook should make but also driving the implementation of changes based on those insights. PQAs thrive in ambiguity and are capable of turning data into convincing stories that influence product teams to prioritize quality in the product. Those who join our team are very passionate about improving experiences for others and are strong advocates for the customers building their business on our platform. We need strong analytically capable influencers who can align cross-functional partners around creating the best possible experience for our customers. The Product Quality Analytics team, is highly cross-functional, working across all teams that make up a Product Team to provide data-driven insights that help define our business strategy, product vision, and roadmap.    Facebook is reshaping the world of advertising and the Product Quality Analytics team will play a central role in determining how successful and sustainable we can be.    If you are passionate about Facebook, interested in advertising, intellectually curious, a fast learner, clever thinker, and have exceptional communication skills, keep reading!    This is a full-time position and is located in Menlo Park, CA. Responsibilities Explore customer experience and product performance data, develop goals and tracking metrics, and ensure product priorities are data-driven and accommodate short-term and long-term goals Develop deep analytical insights around ads product use, stability, performance, and the customer experience across a variety of data sets and platforms Build strategic relationships and manage communication and alignment across multiple partner teams: Partner with Research, Sales Support, and Marketing teams to identify opportunities to improve our products based on customer feedback and help quantify the impact of their qualitative insights Partner with Engineering, Design, and Product Management to implement changes in existing products that positively impact the customer experience and drive new Facebook products that are high quality and low risk Instill a focus on quality in the product culture by creating objective data driven stories that influence and convince product teams to prioritize quality projects Inform, influence, and execute new quality initiatives that are data driven and meaningfully shift core metrics in the positive direction Minimum Qualifications Bachelors Degree and 3+ years post-collegiate work experience doing quantitative analysis or Master or PhD with 2+ years work experience doing quantitative analysis. 2+ years SQL experience 1+ years of experience in Python, R, Perl or other scripting language. Understanding of statistics and mathematical concepts 1+ years of experience in Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, or other data visualization tools. Analytical skills, with experience building product intuition, solving problems using data and providing actionable business insights. Experience creating and telling influential stories from data Ability to construct interpersonal relationships across teams, communicate technical content and analytical insights to multiple audiences Self-starter, with ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, drive change through influence, and collaborate with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders Preferred Qualifications Work experience in tech, finance, consulting or related industry Degrees in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other tech or math related fields Internet advertising experience Experience at a software technology company Knowledge of Facebook Ads products

summary: (Menlo Park, CA) Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. The individual in this role is a skilled and knowledgeable advocate for data management and data transparency. This individual will work with data owners from across the organization to develop, implement, populate and support a successful data management program and open data portal. This position requires a blend of proven technology skills, experience in data manipulation, data analysis, data management, communication skills, and customer outreach. Successful completion of a post-offer background check and drug test are required.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Program Responsibilities: Serves as the lead for the organization’s data management/governance program Serves as the administrator for the Open Data Portal and an advocate for data transparency Develops the project and program goals, defines deliverables and workplans, provides progress reports and program updates Takes lead role in developing the understanding, acceptance and use of the open data portal by staff and the public Facilitates community and team meetings, provides program and project updates to key stakeholders, supports the organization in our open data efforts Facilitate community engagement for the purposes of using public data in story-telling and problem solving  Advocate and Partner Responsibilities: Forms strong working relationship with data owners and works closely with them on the successful identification, migration and presentation of data sets in the portal; assists in the resolution of data integrity issues; identifies and evaluates manual and automated procedures and recommends possible changes; assists in developing technical training and support materials; develops and conducts end user trainings; celebrates program milestones and successes  Technical Responsibilities: Develops and maintains the portal and platform, and the various functions, to enable access and use by data owners and customers Manages all aspects of the portal, including but not limited to: permissions and application security guidelines; creation, maintenance and replacement of data categories, catalogues and sources; diagnoses and resolves software problems; updates software code; software development, modification and testing; creates and maintains application interfaces as needed; works with vendors on technical support for Portal software and interfaces; supports 3 rd party or hosted software as required for the program; provides 24/7 support, as needed Ability to manipulate data in a variety of formats to perform extract-transform-load processes.  IT Department Staff member: Works in partnership within the IT Department and across the organization to accomplish departmental, program and portal goals and objectives; abides by City IT standards; keeps up with industry advances in technology; increases awareness, shares information and builds capacity within the IT Department Supervisory Responsibilities: This position is not responsible for the supervision of City employees. This position may be responsible to lead project teams comprised of City staff.  Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; and talk or hear. The employee must occasionally stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.  Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those encountered while performing the essential functions of this job. This job is predominantly performed in an office setting. The employee may occasionally be exposed to risk of electrical shock or to fumes or airborne particles and outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Work outside the standard work-week is expected. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Qualifications/Skills, Knowledge and Abilities: Program and Project Management skills Strong facilitation, training and communication skills Ability to solve problems effectively, efficiently and collaboratively Strong customer service ethic Proficient in the use and support of cloud - based applications. Knowledge and demonstrated experience managing large data repositories/warehouses Knowledge and demonstrated experience installing, configuring and supporting reporting environments Ability to research, design and develop complex reports using tools such as Crystal Reports. Knowledge and demonstrated experience of computer programming techniques and practices sufficient to develop scripts, reports, and smaller scale programs and integrations. Knowledge of relational database concepts, including design, administration, security, access and support, preferably Oracle and SQL. Proven ability to work effectively with a variety of internal and external clients to identify and address their needs Ability to read, analyze and interpret technical documents common to this environment. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with users, co-workers and vendors while participating on inter- and intra-departmental teams.  EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree in computer science, CIS, Management Information Systems or related field from an accredited college or university plus five years of related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information resolve problems, and respond to questions from groups of managers, employees, clients, customers, and the general public. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, mathematical, or diagram form and to deal with multiple abstract and concrete variables. Certificates, Licenses and Registrations : Valid driver’s license preferred. title: Reporting Analyst
summary: We'll put you in the driver's seat on vital projects that have strategic importance to our mission of helping people lead healthier lives. Yes, we share a mission that inspires. We need your organizational talents and business discipline to help fuel ours. It's the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)Primary Responsibilities:  Use your analytical skills to design / develop, program, and maintain reports and visualizations that provide insight to internal partners and external clients Make solid recommendations based on the analysis and provide explanations for reporting results for both internal operations and our customers You must be self-directed and creative as you will deal with some very interesting and complex issues As a key resource to others you must maintain a high degree of accuracy along with attention to detail, excellent oral and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills and the ability to always meet deadlines Experience with statistical and visualizations tools Specific experience with SAS and Tableau Generally work is self-directed and not prescribed Works with less structured, more complex issues  This is an office based position. You may be located in one of the following areas: Irvine, CA Schaumburg, IL Eden Prairie, MN  Required Qualifications: BA/BS in MIS, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business or a related field 2 or more years of experience performing significant data analysis and report development Intermediate level of programming knowledge (reporting code) and of relational databases, database structures and design, systems design, data management, data warehouse Intermediate level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Access and PowerPoint 1 or more years of experience with SQL 1 or more years of experience with statistical tools such as SAS or R 1 or more years of experience creating visualizations in Tableau or R  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
