title: Data Analyst
summary: EXPECTATIONS AND NATURE OF THE POSITION   The Data Analyst is responsible for the extraction, collection, validation, organization, and reporting of data and information to support accreditation compliance, policy development, strategic planning, program review, student learning assessment, and other continuous quality improvement efforts. This individual will develop effective and accurate data retrieval strategies, design queries, and produce reports to support future planning and data-informed decision making for the institution. Essential to this position are strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills with high-level understanding of data definitions, data sources, extraction logic, and methodologies. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, with excellent time-management skills and an ability to concentrate on complex and multiple tasks for extended periods of time. This individual must possess an ability to prioritize and balance multiple tasks and projects and meet project deadlines, while simultaneously ensuring data integrity and accuracy.   This position exists in a collaborative, team-oriented environment with a proactive, service-based attitude toward a wide variety of constituents. The individual will be cross-trained to provide basic support in other areas covered by the Planning and Improvement Office. The Data Analyst must have strong listening skills to understand reporting needs and tailor data-gathering efforts as appropriate. The ability to communicate with individuals who lack data or technical backgrounds is essential; proficiency in technical writing and visual data presentation is advantageous. Additionally, fostering sound relationships with internal and external stakeholders is essential; a significant level of trust and diplomacy is required, in addition to courtesy and tact.   It is expected that this individual will accomplish assigned duties in an efficient, effective and competent manner and strive for continuous improvement in all work performed. Additionally, this individual must understand the comprehensive role of the community college and cooperate and work harmoniously with College personnel, students, and the public. Some travel is required.   PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   1. Responds to routine and ad hoc data requests from a variety of internal and external audiences. Works with requestors to define their needs; provides timely and accurate information to effectively meet those needs.   2. Determines the best data source for each reporting project and utilizes appropriate tools to collect data, prepare for analysis, and present to requestors. Exhibits comprehensive understanding of the data, and is able to communicate nuances of various data sets to others.   3. Researches and resolves problems in accuracy of data systems. Organizes and cross-checks data to ensure integrity and validity; provides solutions for enhancing data accuracy and streamlining reporting processes.   4. Serves as Western’s representative to the Wyoming Community College Data Governance and Institutional Research Council. Represents Western’s preferences regarding data coding and reporting; works with Commission staff to provide input regarding statewide reporting. Assists with the Statewide Data Governance effort as needed. Reports decisions and relevant conversations to Director of Planning and Improvement.   5. Serves as primary administrator of user permissions for reporting tools such as Colleague Reporting and Operating Analytics ( CROA ) and Tableau. Serves as a reference for other users on campus in regard to these tools and use of SQL Server Management Studio for reporting purposes.   OTHER COLLEGE - RELATED DUTIES   1. Operates within the professional confines of established Western Wyoming Community College Policies and Procedures.   2. Serves on various committees and councils as required; represents the College in a professional manner.   3. Maintains confidentiality of information exposed to in the course of business regarding students and employees.   4. Keeps abreast of professional development by attending conferences, seminars, and workshops and by reading appropriate professional literature.   5. Serves as a resource person to the community as a whole and to various special audiences by offering expert presentations, answering specific inquires, and locating information.   6. Safeguards institutional physical resources by caring properly for assigned assets and by prohibiting unauthorized use. Maintains safe working conditions and practices at all times.   7. Performs other duties as required.   Minimum Qualifications  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, Knowledge, and Abilities)   1. Graduation from a regionally-accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, or other quantitative, analytical, or technological field that provides the required skills for the position.   2. Three years of experience working with complex relational databases such as Colleague. Working knowledge of SQL , Access, Excel, Business Intelligence tools (such as CROA ), and data visualization tools (such as Tableau).   Equivalency Statement  For those candidates who do not exactly meet all the minimum qualifications, an equivalent combination of education and experience which has provided comparable knowledge and abilities will be acceptable.   Preferred Qualifications  PREFERRED ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, Knowledge, and Abilities)   1. Working knowledge of descriptive statistics, Ellucian Colleague, Colleague Reporting and Operating Analytics ( CROA ), and Tableau.   2. Familiarity with national and state-level educational trends and initiatives related to planning, institutional effectiveness, accreditation, and accountability reporting.   3. Prior experience with institutional research techniques, statistical analysis, student learning outcomes assessment, or survey construction.   Open Date  11/20/2017   Close Date   Open Until Filled  Yes   Special Instructions to Applicants  Review of applications will begin December 7, 2017.

title: Data Analyst
summary: The Data Analyst will interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques; develop and implement data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The position will develop reports and strategize ways to utilize data to improve operations and ensure best practices. ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports Implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Design backup processes for data Create accounts for all users and assign security levels for data software Establish a disaster recovery protocol Provide end-to-end technical support and problem resolution for database Create database management procedures Evaluate data analysis models and procedures Train staff across programs Demonstrate exceptional customer service, in everything you do, by placing the child, family, Veteran or client first to support our mission to “ Empower people to build better lives for themselves, their families and their communities.”  ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS: EDUCATION: BS in Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.  EXPERIENCE: 2+ years’ professional experience or internship; Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.  TECHNICAL: Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and assistance. Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc). Familiarity with reporting tools.  LICENSES: Driver’s License with clear record required.  VEHICLE: Must have daily use of a vehicle without prior notice.  OTHER: Must be available and willing to travel to various locations and with such frequency as the business need dictates. Must be available and willing to work occasional evenings, weekends for meetings or other job?]related activities.  EXCEPTIONS TO THESE CRITERIA MUST BE APPROVED BY THE DEPARTMENT HEAD.  ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES: COMMUNICATION: Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively via oral or written means. Ability to communicate appropriately with all levels of individuals. Ability to present a friendly and positive demeanor to all. Ability to make oral presentations.  COMPOSURE: Good interpersonal skills, tact, diplomacy, creativity and customer service. Ability to remain calm and maintain self-control in the midst of difficult circumstances and emergencies. Ability to represent the agency and respond professionally in all situations.  DECISION MAKING: Ability to think analytically and evaluate the impact of program decisions and resolve problems. Ability to set work priorities and to evaluate and create solutions to work related problems.  ORGANIZATION: Professional and organized with a keen attention to detail. A team player with the ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously, on deadline and within a rapid-paced work environment.  PLANNING: Task oriented with the ability to plan, organize, prioritize and execute duties as assigned, within changing conditions. Ability to work proactively and independently to accomplish assigned goals.  TRAINING REQUIREMENTS: Orientation: 5 hours  On the Job: 3+ months for basic competency  MACHINES, TOOLS, EQUIPMENT, WORK AIDS: Multi-line telephone, computer, ten key calculator, printers, copiers, faxes, scanners.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Constant – Ability to communicate with internal and external customers to determine needs and actions to be taken.  Frequent – Ability to input data into computer, make calculations, complete paperwork, produce reports.  Frequent – Ability to drive safely and recognize hazards.  Occasional – Ability to lift, stack, load and move up to 15 pounds from varied heights.  WORKING CONDITIONS: Indoors: 80% - Office environment; generally normal noise level.  Outdoors: 20% - All weather conditions and variable temperatures. Frequent distance travel.

title: Data Analyst - Product
summary: Bellhops is a new breed of moving company built on technology. The industry today is riddled with inefficiencies and–more often than not–a reputation for letting customers down. We believe moving should be something you look forward to. We think it should be fun, even. That’s why we set out to do just that with an industry-first business model that brings down costs and empowers our movers (bellhops) to deliver unforgettable, “high-five” moving experiences. We are America’s Smartest Move.™   This is where you come in…   We are looking for a motivated, impact-driven analyst to join our small, fast moving Data team. We track hundreds of variables and signals to solve a wide range of challenging problems, from finding the best movers for a move, guiding on-the-ground operations, to ensuring steady marketplace dynamics. The impact of data reaches well beyond the products we build - it informs our thinking, helps us prioritize, and is the foundation of decision-making at Bellhops.   Key Responsbilities Analyze: Perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns. Provide reliable access to high quality data through dashboards and reports. Strategize: Identify, prioritize, and inform important product questions with data. These outputs will directly influence our product roadmap. Experiment: You’ll build quick prototypes to validate and test out new ideas; run experiments to learn, measure and make sound business decisions. Build: Develop analytic models and work closely with cross-functional teams and people to implement solutions. Ship stable, high quality solutions at a fast pace. Influence : Be a champion for the data. Envision a world different than the status quo and articulate a clear path for everyone in the company to get there. The Ideal Candidate BS/MS in a quantitative science, including Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research or related field 3-5 years of industry experience in a quantitative role using statistics, experimental design, and machine learning methods to deliver actionable business value, preferably in retail, marketplace or other customer facing industry Programming and analytical experience using SQL, Python, R Deep experience in one or more of: Statistical Modeling, Machine Learning, Data Visualization techniques. Previous experience solving Optimization, Prediction or Recommendation problems with real-word data is a huge plus. Good judgment in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for proposed solutions under minimal guidance Ability to clearly communicate and articulate results to both technical and non-technical audiences Bias for action and an appreciation for the knowledge-impact sweet spot Why work at Bellhops? Because moving stinks... - Moving is one of the most stressful times in people’s lives. You can be a part of our crusade to turn a stressful process into an enjoyable one, and transform a $15B industry. … and we have the recipe to fix it - Our tech enabled approach and innovative business model have given us a huge head start in disrupting the industry. You’ll be joining us at a time when you have the opportunity to make a huge impact, to chart the course for the future of moving. Our culture and team sets us apart - We have an irreverent ownership culture that is steeped in a love for our hops and our customers. You will be empowered every day to completely own your portion of the business, experiment with new ideas, and represent the team. You’ll be doing so alongside some super smart, driven, and happy colleagues. Perks! - We are competitive in our offer packages and provide a significant equity incentive. We also have a complete set of perks including health, dental, maternity leave, etc. We’re located in the heart of the Innovation District of Chattanooga, TN on the 5th floor of a 100+ year old warehouse building on top of some of the best restaurants/bars in the city. Never heard of Chattanooga? Do yourself a favor and Google a few images. We’ve been elected as Best Town Ever by Outdoor Magazine, Best Outdoor City by Blue Ridge Outdoors, and many others. It’s an outdoor mecca, smack in the middle of world class hiking, rock climbing, mountain biking, hang gliding, and watersports. Local breweries, awesome food, and the closest thing we have to an hour commute is when we drive down to Atlanta for a Braves or Falcons game.

company: Council for Affordable Quality Healthcare Inc
title: Data Analyst II
summary: The Data Analyst II is responsible for leveraging data to identify actionable trends and patterns that support business, technology and operations decision-making. Through a combination of domain expertise, expert product knowledge and strong data skills, the Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst reports to Senior Product Manager. This position is full time, exempt.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Import, clean, transform, validate or model complex data sets from multiple sources in order to understand and answer business questions surrounding: Data quality Operational improvement opportunities Strategic planning Market insights Customer-facing business queries Usage metrics for CAQH utilities Identify root causes for problems related to adoption, usage, operations and quality, and identify improvements by pinpointing trends, correlations and patterns in complicated data sets. Design and present data and conclusions in charts, graphs and tables. Maintain ongoing reports. Develop and maintain data quality assurance measures and processes. Build out and automate CAQH internal and external reporting and analytics capabilities. Recommend data migration approaches for product upgrades. Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality. Design and develop relational databases for collecting data; write Data Definition Language or Data Manipulation Language SQL commands.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Demonstrated self-starter and creative thinker who can handle a considerable amount of unstructured, real world data and be comfortable thinking about solving problems using new and novel approaches. Experience using one or more business intelligence software tools (Tableau, Cognos, Business Objects, etc.). Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (SPSS, SAS, Excel, etc.). Knowledge of a querying language such as SQL and the ability to write code without depending on an intermediary, guided interface (drag and drop tool). Ability to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and present data in a way that is intuitive to technical as well as nontechnical users. Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize a full plate. Ability to work collaboratively and effectively across matrix organizations in a fast-paced, schedule-driven and entrepreneurial environment.  EXPERIENCE: Minimum of four years of hands-on experience in a data analyst role. 2+ years of performing data analysis in support of a product organization. Healthcare experience preferred (payer or revenue cycle management).  EDUCATION: Bachelors degree required; Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics disciplines preferred.  WHO WE ARE  Named one of Modern Healthcares Best Places to Work in 2016 and 2017, CAQH, a non-profit alliance, is the leader in creating shared initiatives to streamline the business of healthcare. Through collaboration and innovation, CAQH accelerates the transformation of business processes, delivering value to providers, patients and health plans. COB Smart quickly and accurately directs coordination of benefits processes. EnrollHub reduces costly paper checks with enrollment for electronic payments and electronic remittance advice. CAQH ProView (formerly Universal Provider Database®) eases the burden of provider data collection, maintenance and distribution. VeriFide TM streamlines credentialing by standardizing and automating PSV. DirectAssure ® increases the accuracy of provider directories. SanctionsTrack® delivers comprehensive, multi-state information on healthcare provider licensure disciplinary actions. CAQH CORE® maximizes business efficiency and savings by developing and implementing federally mandated operating rules. CAQH Index benchmarks progress and helps optimize operations by tracking industry adoption of electronic administrative transactions.  WHAT YOU GET  CAQH recognizes that its most important asset is its growing team of smart, creative, collaborative, forward-thinking and passionate professionals - and that a comprehensive employee benefits package is an important factor for them in choosing where to work. CAQH offers competitive compensation along with an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, tuition assistance and a 401k. Our location in downtown Washington, DC is metro-accessible, has an onsite fitness center and is centrally located to allow our team to take advantage of professional networking opportunities, cultural offerings and a thriving social scene.

title: Business Reporting Analyst
summary: Opportunity at a Glance As the Business Reporting Analyst you are responsible for system and business process support of multiple systems. These systems are utilized by functional business groups across multiple higher education institutions.  You are successful in this position due to your experience supporting business processes and information systems for business groups - ideally in higher education. Your strong communication skills enable you to communicate with both technical and business-focused colleagues and leaders. You have knowledge of project management principles and the capacity to learn advanced systems, technology and technical environments. Utilizing your experience and skills enables you to optimize systems processes and improve business efficiencies. Responsibilities Working as the Business Reporting Analyst, you will: Provide regularly scheduled and ad hoc reports from assigned business systems. Develop reports and dashboards using advanced reporting tools such as Cognos BI, MS Power BI and other business intelligence analytical tools. Execute, maintain and deliver process requests. Oversee the deliverables and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for each of the systems you are responsible for. This could include: setting up system profiles, Q/A testing, tracking/forecasting call volumes and colleague activities, establishing omni-channel system campaigns and other tasks as needed. Serve as the Subject Matter Expert and consultant resource, possessing good working knowledge of multiple business and system processes in one or more of the following areas: CRM, SIS, Student Finance/AR, Workforce Management, Telephony and Omni-channel systems. Work and communicate with business leaders at all levels to identify needs. You will determine and recommend system and analytic solutions, as well as documenti data requirements. Develop reports and/or system processes that support and optimize business performance. Serve as liaison with technical teams in IT to communicate business needs, determine level of effort and prioritize against other initiatives. You contribute to drive processes and system improvements for various system enhancements. Document and track activities associated with different academic partners Completes other duties as assigned. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree is required, and a Master’s degree is desired. Strong MS Office skills, especially with MS Excel. 3-5 years of customer service experience, preferably working in at least one of the following higher education areas: Admissions, Registrar Services, Student Finance or Academic Advising. 3-5 years of experience working with CRM, telephony, Workforce Management, SIS systems processes, call center technologies or similar applications is desired. Capacity to learn technical systems and environments, and an interest in developing your technical skills. Experience with project and/or change management is a plus. Detailed-oriented with the ability to work independently, solve problems and drive to solutions. Experience with coding and basic programming languages (e.t. SQL) for advanced analytical tools such as Cognos or Crystal reports is a plus. Ability to work independently, Good written and oral communication skills. We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. Thank you for applying for this outstanding opportunity today. Who We Are The purpose of Adtalem Global Education is to empower students to achieve their goals, find success, and make inspiring contributions to our global community. Adtalem Global Education Inc. (NYSE: ATGE; member S&P MidCap 400 Index) is a leading global education provider and the parent organization of Adtalem Educacional do Brasil, American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine, Becker Professional Education, Carrington College, Chamberlain University, DeVry University and its Keller Graduate School of Management, Ross University School of Medicine and Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine. For more information, please visit adtalem.com.

title: Junior Data Scientist/Software Engineer
summary: Do you like to look at data sets to find trends and tendencies? Do you like dealing with complex, multi-variable problems using cutting-edge analytics? Do you like solving complicated software design puzzles with code that is clean and elegant? CCRi is looking for smart, innovative data scientists with analytical and software engineering skills. We conduct research and development in data mining and machine learning techniques to solve complex problems and then implement scalable solutions in data-driven environments.   Our engineers take cutting edge research and build reliable products out of it. You'll help build massively distributed machine-learning systems, like graph-based embedding frameworks or GPU-clustered neural networks. These tools will be used to attack some of today's most pressing problems like relief planning, image processing, and force protection.   Technology: Hadoop Ecosystem, CUDA   Languages: Scala, Python, Java  Develops: Machine Learning  Runs on: Linux, Browsers   Tools we use:  Statistical Computing: R, NumPy, SciPy, Mathematica, Matlab Modern Programming: Java, C++, Python, Scala, or Ruby Enterprise Development: EE, REST web services, JPA, ORM, dependency injection Traditional Databases: PostgreSQL, MySql, Oracle NoSQL Databases: Accumulo, MongoDB, HBase GIS: Geoserver, PostGIS, OpenLayers, Quantum GIS, ArcGIS Cloud computing: Hadoop, Map-Reduce, Storm, Spark, Scalding, Hive Web Development: Javascript, AJAX, CSS, AngularJS, D3 Machine Learning: Neural Networks, Deep Learning, Random Forest Data Processing and Analytics: Graph analytics, natural language processing, image processing Data visualization: ggplot, D3  Our Tech Stack:   We use Scala, Python, and Javascript on Centos 6+, Ubuntu 14+, and Windows Server machines, managed by PXE, Cobbler, Puppet, and Beaker. Our workflow is built around Git with Jira for issue tracking and Jenkins for Continuous Integration. Most CCRi software is built on the Hadoop ecosystem. We rely on Accumulo and Spark, with Storm seeing significant use as well. We maintain on-premises clusters and use AWS for larger-scale work.   About You: You’ve got a year or more of professional engineering under your belt on significant projects or you have compelling personal projects grounded in machine learning or high-performance computing. Ideally, you have a bachelor’s in Statistics, Mathematics, Systems Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. You are fluent in at least two modern languages including Scala, Java, or Python.   Requirements US citizenship required We DO NOT offer sponsorships or contracting work. This position is for Charlottesville only. Bachelor’s Degree in a technical field Prior Work experience in a related field and/or a working portfolio that clearly demonstrates your abilities. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and status as a US citizen, and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. Failure to do so can and will result in dismissal.   Benefits The Company:   CCRi is a small engineering firm located in Charlottesville, Virginia. We develop and deploy novel machine-learning approaches to real problems at massive scale. Since 1992, we’ve been stopping bombs, predicting piracy, and guiding disaster relief.  Casual Work Environment Intellectually Challenging Work Health Insurance Short Term Disability Insurance Generous Defined Benefit Retirement Very Flexible Vacation Policy Want to know more? Check out our recruitment video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W_b2EY1tlRM Commonwealth Computer Research, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

title: data analyst, Retail Operations - Seattle, WA
summary: Job Summary & Mission  The Operations Analytics team helps Global Operations leaders elevate the customer and partner experience in our retail stores by developing and deploying analytical products and services to enable strategic problem solving. As part of our analytics team, the data analyst will consume business data from numerous sources and make sense of it by conducting data manipulation, cleaning it up and analyzing it. They will drive towards actionable insights and visualize findings in a way that Operations leaders can easily consume. They may build analytical tools or models that help other functions make better decisions for our retail stores. The position reports directly to director of Operations Analytics and frequently collaborates with cross-functional Analytics, Operations and Technology teams at Starbucks.  Summary of Key Responsibilities  · Data Preparation: Extract data from data warehouses and ad hoc sources. Cleanse, join and manipulate large quantities of data . Perform exploratory analysis. · Data Science and Engineering : Support the development of analytical tools or services to deploy data science solutions . Solve difficult problems by applying advanced analytical methods in partnership with analytics leaders. · Decision Science: Apply basic statistical concepts to understand and describe relationships in data. Under guidance of analytics leaders, build predictive models or complex analytics. · Insights Packaging & Presentation: Create impactful visual representations of analytic insights and concise summaries of methodology and findings geared to audience needs. Present selected portions to stakeholders.  · Business Consulting: Participate in discussions with business partners to define business questions. Required Skills & Experiences  B.S. with concentration in quantitative discipline – Statistics, Math, Comp Science, Engineering or similar field 1 - 2 years of work experience in applied analytics, software development or engineering Foundational knowledge of statistics, coding, data mining and manipulation, including familiarity with programming languages, tools and relational databases (e.g., SQL, R, Python, Oracle, RDS, Redshift, Excel) Ability to drive to insights and create visualizations, including knowledge of Tableau or Power BI High levels of intellectual curiosity and ability to work independently Passion for problem solving and developing new solutions quickly

title: Data Science Analyst I - (Mount Sinai Hospital) Day Shift
summary: The Mount Sinai Health System Do you have what it takes to wear the badge?  The Mount Sinai Health System's commitment to excellence extends beyond delivering world-class health care. The System's ongoing success is dependent upon our highly motivated, nonclinical professionals working to improve business operations. Our leadership team is driven to provide exceptional service by cultivating a workforce that is dedicated to upholding Mount Sinai's mission of delivering innovative, breakthrough medicine with compassion and integrity.  Are you ready to discover the world of limitless possibilities that comes with wearing the badge? Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story of unrivaled patient care!  What You'll Do: The Data Science Analyst for Access/Transfer Center collaborates with stakeholders from across the organization to develop sophisticated analytics to provide information, insights and BI (Business Intelligence) solutions that contribute to sound strategic planning, decision-making, goal setting, and effective performance measurement. This individual demonstrates sound understanding of the healthcare domain, technical data manipulation and analytic development skills and impact the patient community of the Mount Sinai Health System. This analyst will be working at Mount Sinai Corporate Office near Grand Central.  Duties and Responsibilities : Analyzes data requests for Access/Transfer Center using information technology, enrollment, claims, clinical, contract, medical management, financial, administrative and other corporate data from both modeled and disparate internal and external sources. Works with departmental staff to identify requirements for reporting and / or business intelligence tools. Identifies necessary data, data sources and methodologies. Collects, organizes, integrates, analyzes and interprets data. Leverages advanced statistical analysis methods to create insightful recommendations and conclusions that may be communicated to the stakeholder. Identifies and addresses expected and unforeseen data complexities to mitigate their impact on the analytic outcome and associated business decisions. Works to improve data quality where possible within created analytical models. Feeds data quality issues back to IT or identified data stewards to facilitate creation of high quality metrics. Develops and may present reports, analyses and findings to senior management and others as scheduled or requested. Responsible for one or more of the following stakeholder groups: Contracting and Commercialization – May assist in the modeling and forecasting contract scenarios, measuring ongoing performance and identify trends in performance to inform our clinical or contracting staff to improve contract outcomes. Care Management – Helps to identify, understand and prioritize at-risk members in need of care management. Helps stratify our membership to optimally use resources to focus on the patients most in need, currently or in the future. Medical Directors – Helps to identify utilization trends and variations across the different categories of health care services to assist the Medical Directors to focus their efforts to maximize contract performance and clinical effectiveness. Quality and Documentation – Helps to link payer quality and documentation opportunities into operational analytic processes to maximize our quality scores, top line revenue and optimize the use of resources in concert with MS Health System contracts. I.T. / High Performance Computing in any ongoing projects. Acts as liaison/analyst for internal stakeholders, understands their needs and translates them into reporting and analytic solutions. Effectively communicates with stakeholders and customers and ensures all requests are properly triaged, recorded and tracked. Adheres to corporate standards for performance metrics, data collection, data integrity, query design, and reporting format to ensure high quality, meaningful analytic output. Helps identify and understand data from internal and external sources for competitive, scenario and performance analyses, and financial modeling to gain member/provider insight into new and existing processes and business opportunities. Works closely with IT on the ongoing improvement of Mount Sinai's integrated data warehouse, driven by strategic and business needs, and designed to ensure data and reporting consistency throughout the organization. Other duties assigned as per Director.  Education : BA or BS degree minimum, in a relevant field of study; Masters degree preferred.  Experience : 2 years minimum in analytics development expertise, preferably in health care, or for a health provider, health plan or accountable care organization, including either: Working knowledge of a health care EMR such as Epic/Clarity, aCW, etc.; a payor claims system such as Facets, Amisys, etc.; or a hospital/provider system such as IDX, Soarian, etc. Knowledge of the New York State Medicaid and CMS Medicare regulations and related reporting requirements, such as STARS,QARR, MMCOR, MEDS, RAPS and HEDIS is a strong plus. Experience working in a health plan or consulting actuarial, financial reporting or medical economics departments highly valuable. Experience working in healthcare provider analytics related to revenue modeling, managed care contracting, population management, case management, clinical or financial decision report Do you share our dedication to extraordinary service and have what it takes to wear the badge? Apply now! title: Analytics Associate
summary: The Global Business Intelligence Team is a core part of Audible’s mission to unleash the power of the spoken word. We use data and complex quantitative methods to bring the joy of Audible to more listeners, understand how they experience our product, and ensure that we serve them premium content. We partner with business stakeholders and senior leadership to ask and answer challenging questions that inform Audible’s strategic decisions and direction.  Our growing team seeks analysts who are passionate about using data to help drive informed decisions for the company and the customer. We’re looking for an analytical and creative thinker, with the ability to ask the right questions and develop a point of view that will influence business decisions. If your ideal job involves working with one of the richest data sets in the world, communicating your insights with leaders across the organization, and having the ability to see your work turned into action, this position may be for you.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:  You will perform comprehensive analysis to develop an in-depth understanding of our product, our content, our listeners and our prospective customers You will work closely with our business stakeholders around the globe to inform their decision making with insights, identifying growth and engagement drivers and areas of opportunity You will interpret results, conclude actionable recommendations and communicate them effectively to your business stakeholders You will cooperate with our Data Science team to create and leverage predictive models that implement our team’s insights at scale  Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics or a related field 5+ years of relevant professional experience in an ecommerce, business intelligence or consulting environment You are a highly analytical mind with a strong business understanding You possess excellent communication skills (verbal and written), including the ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical teams You are a self-starter capable to taking initiative and working with minimal direction, and you enjoy working in a team of highly engaged individuals  Preferred Qualifications MBA preferred Working understanding of SQL, BI software (Microstrategy, Tableau) as well as statistical packages (R, SAS, Python) Experience in the field of digital analytics Familiarity with data infrastructure and instrumentation BENEFITS  We have a comprehensive benefits package. Here are some of the fun and meaningful perks we offer:  Daily catered lunch, Monday breakfast and juice bar, snacks and Friday happy hours Free onsite gym and 25% fitness reimbursement Seasonal sports clubs - basketball, hockey, soccer, volleyball, softball and more Company sponsored events Transit reimbursement, paid parking and shuttle service Tuition assistance Annual Amazon discount Meaningful community involvement opportunities including mentoring interns, literacy tutoring and Audible Scholars, along with collaboration on start-up projects incubating in Newark Venture Partners  Audible, Inc. is the world’s largest seller and producer of spoken audio entertainment, information and educational programming. Since inventing and commercializing the first portable digital audio player in 1997, our focus on technological innovation and superior programming has earned us millions of subscribers around the world. We’re an Amazon subsidiary with a presence on four different continents, yet we maintain a startup vibe and small company feel. We offer more than 375,000 downloadable audiobooks, audio editions of periodicals, and other programs, and an escalating array of listening products that enrich daily life for a growing population of people who want to be more productive, well-informed, and thoughtfully entertained. The Data Scientist will be responsible for assisting in the definition of data mining and machine learning strategies and the execution of corresponding procedures.   Would you like to join this innovative team? if so, do you meet these qualifications? We are one of the nation's largest and fastest-growing auto insurers thanks to our low rates, outstanding service and clever marketing. We're an industry leader employing thousands of dedicated and hard-working associates. Our associates' quality of life is important to us. Full-time GEICO associates are offered a comprehensive Total Rewards Program*, including:  401(k) and profit-sharing plans Medical, dental, vision and life insurance Paid vacation, holidays and leave programs Tuition reimbursement Associate assistance program Flexible spending accounts Business casual dress Fitness and dining facilities (at most locations) Associate clubs and sports teams Volunteer opportunities GEICO Federal Credit Union  * Benefit offerings for positions other than full-time may vary. title: Data Analyst
summary: Sharecare is the digital health company that helps people manage all their health in one place. The Sharecare platform provides each person - no matter where they are in their health journey - with a comprehensive and personalized health profile, where they can dynamically and easily connect to the information, evidence-based programs and health professionals they need to live their healthiest, happiest and most productive life. With award-winning and innovative frictionless technologies, scientifically validated clinical protocols and best-in-class coaching tools, Sharecare helps providers, employers and health plans effectively scale outcomes-based health and wellness solutions across their entire populations. We are always looking for people that value the opportunity to work hard, have fun on the job, and make a difference in the lives of others through their work every day!  Job Summary: The Data Analyst role will be working with several facets of the Sharecare data environment. The role will primarily facilitate the member selection process into Sharecares weekly sales emails. We use proprietary technology and programs to build these lists according to very specific criteria. The role will creatively determine how to meet these requirements while also guaranteeing the delivery of contractual quantities. The role will also involve reporting and analytics on the relevant member populations, as well as special ad-hoc deep statistical analyses. Specifically, the duties and responsibilities of the new role are the following:  Essential Functions: Apply the day-to-day logistics of Sharecares complex email marketing function. Sharecare emails are highly targeted to the individual member Create email campaigns based on Sales targeting using SFMC and other in house tools Understand the Sharecare data ETL processes Work closely with Sales and Client Services to ensure the marketing visions of the campaigns are realized through the most appropriate targeting. Develop reporting based on member registration and interaction with the site/email campaigns Prepare and maintain weekly, monthly, quarterly reports. Pull counts based on various criteria required by sales and client services team. Leverage statistical tools such as R/SPSS to analyze and identify insights on email campaigns to personalize future targeting.  Qualifications: Bachelor's in a Quantitative Field Excellent verbal and written (reports, presentations, direct mail, etc.) skills  Specific Skills/Attributes: Fluent in SQL-based language, preferably Vertica Comfortable using GUIs to develop queries Comfortable with statistical tool, preferably R. Advanced excel (pivots and vlookups) Salesforce, especially programming, a plusExperience with SFMC ExactTarget is a plus Experience with Visualization tools such as Qlik Basic understanding of ETL processes and data warehouse concepts Excellent communication skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Must enjoy working in a team environment Excellent attention to detail Sharecare, Inc. and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. title: Data Scientist
summary: Here’s the gist: Vettery is a tech company, but what we ultimately do is help people find their dream job. We are looking for self-starters who care about helping people find a job they love! It’s pretty simple, we are looking for hungry people with an energy to disrupt an ancient industry, while also enjoying the perks of a growing startup.  Vettery is growing quickly and this role has the potential for huge impact on our trajectory. The focus of the data science team is on digitizing recruiting from candidate sourcing to profile “vetting” and curation to making the best matches between candidates and companies. We’re looking to add a Data Scientist to work on decision support, product optimization, and operation scaling projects across these areas. You’ll be reporting directly to our Director of Data Science and working closely with the product and engineering teams. The ideal candidate is a critical thinker and a good communicator who excels in a fast-paced environment.  Responsibilities:  Build machine learning infrastructure and models (e.g. recommendation engines, statistical models, NLP engines) that drive activity on our platform, scale our business, and enhance the user experience Collaborate with engineering and product leaders, as well as the co-founders, to frame and tackle a problem, both mathematically and within the business context Develop creative solutions to our biggest data science and engineering challenges Communicate rationale for decisions and findings from analyses to facilitate operation decisions Design and track experiments for data science products as well as analyses throughout the organization In short, contribute meaningfully on all phases of the data science product lifecycle (exploratory data analysis, model development, model productionizing, rollout, and evaluation)  Requirements:  Ph.D. in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field 2+ years of industry experience delivering and scaling successful and innovative machine learning products (e.g. recommendation engines, experimentation systems) Track record of success working both independently and with key stakeholders to identify and solve data science problems Strong skills in statistical languages (e.g. Python/R) and querying languages (e.g. SQL) Experience with NLP a plus! (but not required) With the above said, we always encourage people of all backgrounds and experiences to apply. We understand that job listings don't always allow your unique work history to shine so we invite you to show us what you know!  The laundry list of tech we like: Python, PHP, Angular, Elasticsearch, AWS, MySQL, Apache. On the Data Science side, we're using Microservices API serving recommendations for our web app (Python, SQLAlchemy, MySQL, Flask).  Benefits:  Competitive salary Open vacation & sick time Medical, vision, and dental insurance Apple laptop computer Frequent team outings, lunches, and team building events A beautiful office in Union Square, recently named one of Crain’s 100 Best Places to Work ( http://www.crainsnewyork.com/article/20160928/SMALLBIZ/160929892/crains-unveils-the-100-best-places-to-work-in-new-york-city-in-2016 ) in New York City Lots of free food: stocked kitchen + beverages

risk teams to define problems, data collection, synthesize relevant data, build analytical models and forecasts  Communicate recommendations and drive improvements  Capture requirements, translate customer problems into predictive analytics, clearly communicate results in both written and oral presentations, demonstrate predictive analytics capabilities and solutions to prospective clients title: Summer Research Program Intern in Data Clustering
summary: About the Intelligence and Decision Technologies Group :   The Intelligence and Decision Technologies Group develops prototypes to demonstrate innovative command and control technology and open system architectures that measurably improve intelligence and military decision making. This work begins with an understanding of the workflows of intelligence analysts and military commanders, often through operations research. Operational data sets are amassed to support all types of algorithm development, such as multisensor fusion, “big data” mining, cloud technologies, graph-based network detection, and artificial intelligence, including deep learning. The group guides the nation in the adoption of open architecture standards in air, space, and cyber platforms. Prototype systems for data exploitation and knowledge management are delivered for evaluation in theater. Areas of technical staff expertise include systems analysis, modeling and simulation, feature extraction and pattern analysis, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning, software development, and field experimentation.   Job Title: Summer Research Intern in Clustering with Probabilistic Programming   Position Description: As more and more features are aggregated together to attempt to extract meaning from data, it will be nearly impossible to collect all features for all measurements. To address this problem, algorithms are needed that can naturally account for missing features in multivariate data sets. Previous research has led to algorithms that can cluster multivariate Gaussian data with missing features in measurements. The summer research project will be to develop more advanced algorithms that can handle missing data. The current interest is in algorithms that can model prior distributions on cluster means and covariance matrices with the normal-Wishart distribution while still accounting for missing data fields. At this time, an analytic solution to the derivation of the posterior probability distribution is unknown. An alternative approach is to use numerical integration.   The goal of this project is to develop an algorithm to cluster data with missing fields with a probabilistic programming language. The project will require the development of a few different approaches to clustering multivariate data with missing data. The distributions will be restricted to normal, Wishart and T distributions. A probabilistic programming language will be used to write a variety of programs that numerically solve the required integrals to produce posterior estimates and to estimate the optimal assignments of incomplete data to clusters.   Requirement: The candidate should be enrolled in a BS, MS or PhD degree program with a major in electrical engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related field.   Desired Skills: The ideal candidate should have a firm grasp of Bayesian probability theory, statistics, integral calculus, linear algebra and the ability to program effectively in a probabilistic programming language. Experience with fourth-generation languages (MATLAB, R, or equivalent), machine learning algorithms, and data analysis techniques are highly desirable.   Keywords: Probabilistic programming, machine learning, probability theory, statistics, mathematics, clustering, missing data   MIT Lincoln Laboratory is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information; U.S. citizenship is required.

title: Data Scientist
summary: BROOKLYN, NEW YORK  StrongArm is the world’s leading safety science company, capturing, analyzing and delivering actionable insights that drive worker safety and enterprise value. Utilizing complex smart sensors and machine learning StrongArm can effectively develop, manufacture and deploy the next generation of industrial safety equipment. Ensuring the backbone of our economy - the Industrial Athlete - is Proud, Protected and Productive.  POSITION OVERVIEW: As “Data Scientist”, you will play a vital role in leading the data intelligence, analytics strategy, delivering data-driven insights, and ultimately driving product innovation - impacting millions of industrial workers around the world. StrongArm’s clients span across multiple industries such as 3PL, Distribution Centers, Manufacturing, Industrial Technology, Transportation, etc.  You will be responsible for looking at a tremendous amount of data, developing hypothesis and creating models to generate valuable insights to enhance core product features of the FUSE Risk Management Platform and deliver business intelligence to our clients. You will have the opportunity to set the foundations for the future of data science, analytics, and the infrastructure related to scale this rapidly growing part of the company and product.  You will interface with subject matter experts in the field of safety science, ergonomics, and industrial hygiene, software engineers for implementation, and customer facing team members to help drive new insights to customers. You must be able to thrive in a fast-past design culture, and enjoy holding real responsibilities solving challenging problems.  The ideal candidate for this position must have strong data and business intelligence background. We’re looking for someone who is driven and passionate about data, with the ability to communicate and present data models, tests, results, and implications.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Data Modeling / Testing / Implementation:  Interpreting existing and new data sets to discover new insights that feed directly into product, sales, and business opportunities Cleaning, validating, and ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and uniformity of all data inputs and outputs. Lead the Data Science & Analytics team, focusing on the design and execution of advanced analytical data exploration, mining, inference, models and systems Develop and deliver high-impact tools and insights comprised of aggregated data sets and advanced algorithms with a clean user experience both internally and externally Utilizing advanced analytical methods and complex models, drive the manipulation, refinement, and integration of new and existing data from the FUSE IIoT sensors and the client’s injury, claims, and EH&S data  Data Communication and Reporting:  Translate complex data problems, solutions, and implications to various stakeholders of the organization including customers Provide guidance to and collaborate with the data analytics team to deliver comprehensive and accurate safety insights for the client Drive the delivery of a clear and robust data narrative and storytelling for all FUSE Platform accounts, showcasing FUSE data value in-depth, accuracy, and pertinence Serve as the subject matter expert in all things data Be the data communication lead for internal stakeholders; equip sales, marketing, and client services with intelligence on data-related topics and account-specific data insights  KEY REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS:  3+ years of experience in an advanced analytics or consulting role or similar experience in academia Advanced Degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) with a specialization in a “STEM” major Experience and demonstrated proficiency in statistical methods (i.e., parametric and non-parametric regression, time-series, panel data analysis, survival analysis, etc.) and machine learning techniques (i.e., methods of supervised and unsupervised learning such as clustering, regression, classification, ensemble methods, etc.) Deep knowledge and expertise of multiple analytics and programming languages such as R or Python A strong understanding of the differences between inferential and predictive models and experience applying methods in both areas At least one or more published academic papers Experience with data visualization techniques and concepts Experience in consulting and/or leading projects that encompass direct interaction with internal business clients  PREFERRED SKILLS/ EXPERIENCE:  Experience with computer vision and metadata generation from IIoT devices or wearables Previous experience with Scala, Java, Spark, Hive and/or Hadoop Adaptable and flexible to changing business needs Strong ability to work and problem-solve independently, collaboratively, and creatively  StrongArm Technologies is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Automation Informatics & Data Analyst
summary: Bachelors, Masters or PhD in Computer Science/Engineering + experience in the industry  Experience developing and implementing data management and analysis tools.  Demonstrated ability to work in multi-disciplinary matrix teams, displaying excellent interpersonal skills.  Strong organizational and communication skills (both written and oral), with the ability to liaise with scientists and external collaborators at all levels.  Inquisitive, creative and bold.   Preferred qualifications:  Experience with imaging data analysis preferred.  Demonstrated understanding of drug discovery and familiarity with integrated automation systems, such as those employed in High Throughput Screening in the Pharmaceutical industry is desired.  Experience with bioactivity data analysis and molecular profiling is desired.   Details:  Are you inquisitive? Creative? Bold? GlaxoSmithKline is a science-led global healthcare company that researches and develops a broad range of innovative products in the areas of Pharmaceuticals, Vaccines and Consumer Healthcare, and we need individuals like you to join us in disrupting Healthcare. Together, with a newly formed team of diverse and multi-disciplinary scientists, you will help us create new Intelligent and Automated platforms that will help the company rapidly discover and develop novel medicines to help patients do more, feel better and live longer.   The Discovery Biology Automation team is designing a data-intensive and complex workflow to accelerate drug discovery, which will include the automation of data capture, analysis, integration and model building. Specifically, we are seeking an automation informatics & data analyst dedicated to working on individual pipeline/project efforts, as well as designing and implementing automated informatics workflows that will ultimately be tied to our robotic platform. There is also a need to develop tools for remote instrument & robotic control as well as integrated QC tools to enable 24/7 operation of robotic platforms. The successful individual will be responsible for drawing upon experience and collaborating with internal experts to establish robust data flows associated with automated systems, enabling intelligent and automated drug discovery. In these uncharted territories, this individual will need to be inquisitive, creative and bold.   Key Responsibilities:  Develop and implement efficient data capture, archiving, analysis and model-building workflows in concert with integrated automation platforms to enable intelligent drug discovery.  Develop tools for remote instrument & robotic control as well as integrated QC tools to enable 24/7 operation.  Design and build online data management and analytic capabilities for automated robotic platforms, as well as corresponding user interfaces.  Connectivity of automated systems with LIMS and coordination of high performance computing.  Work with the team to interface computational algorithms, sample storage and chemical synthesis platforms to the biology automation platform.  Independently author scientific papers and presentations, and help represent the team and GlaxoSmithKline at internal and external scientific meetings.   Closing date: 31st October 2017   Contact information:  You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button. title: Growth Marketing Analyst
summary: We are looking for a Growth Marketing Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product, engineering, and marketing. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical, marketing, and product background – with a hunger to make businesses grow.   You will be responsible for the full execution of your growth marketing strategy: planning, executing, analyzing, and optimizing. As the primary analyst of the Marketing & Communications team, you will also be responsible for the development of data-driven insights and recommendations to help improve our product and marketing effectiveness. You will be on the cutting edge of analysis, leveraging our data sources to propose new ideas and drive key strategic decisions through both offline and online efforts.   In this role you will: Strategically lead and efficiently scale paid customer acquisition strategy (online and offline) across channels including (but not limited to): paid social, paid search, content marketing, organic referral, email, influencer marketing, podcast ads, video advertising, etc. Leverage data to understand our products and marketing in depth, identify areas of opportunity, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement. Drive projects focusing on new user growth, mobile usage, and revenue - working closely with product, marketing, and engineering. Mine data and analytics to gain a better understanding of user funnel and engagement behaviors, including impacts of current marketing strategies. Implement and analyze A/B or Multivariate Tests to provide in-depth insights to the marketing team on the test data and understanding of marketing drivers’ effects. We are looking for: BS or MS or equivalent experience. 2+ years experience with SQL. 2+ years of quantitative or statistical analysis experience. 2+ years of experience in marketing, advertising or growth. An analytical mindset, with advanced knowledge of Excel, SQL, third party analytics, A/B testing software, and attribution platforms strongly preferred. Strong data visualization skills Communication skills and ability to manage a project or product. Familiar with marketing funnels and the economics of user acquisition. E-commerce experience a huge plus (either in web or mobile). Benefits and perks: Join the early team and work closely with founders on all aspects of the company Medical, dental and vision coverage Competitive salary and generous equity grants Daily catered lunches from LA’s best restaurants

title: Analyst - Marketing Analytics
summary: BUSINESS IMPACT STATEMENT The Marketing Analyst for Insights is a mid-level analyst that is responsible for the identification and communication of business insights through the analysis of customer, sales, promotional, digital, and competitive data. This position is responsible for identifying business questions, extracting the data through relational databases or cloud platforms, analyzing and interrupting the data, and developing insights into stories to assist with business critical decisions.  ACCOUNTABILITIES Analysis Set Up Review standard and intermediate ad hoc analysis requests from business partners for all customer, program, offer, and channel needs. Consult with business partners to identify primary and secondary business analyses and KPIs required to support critical business decisions. Develop end to end project timelines for analysis deliveries Data Manipulation and Visualization Identify and collect primary and secondary data variables to holistically answer business questions Maintain an understanding of the structure and location of various data sources to be utilized Independently pull and manipulate data to determine results and develop data visualizations into relevant conclusions Identify and set up processes for data quality checks Assist senior analyst in the set up and data pull for analyzing various marketing programs including A/B Testing Insight and Implication Development Review relevant data sets and analyses to develop detailed and informed insights and implications to inform strategy and decisions. Organize insights, data and visualizations into comprehensive stories for distribution to leadership partners in support internal business decisions. Presentation & Knowledge Sharing Review analyses with manager and team members. Present completed analyses to business partners and follow up to ensure understanding of insight implications. QUALIFICATIONS Required Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent Basic SQL and/or SAS skills Strong communication skills Experience presenting complex data analyses to lateral business partners Basic Experience with Tableau/Visualization Software Experience  This describes general information about the position however should not be considered comprehensive. Our company reserves the right to modify job duties or descriptions at any time. This is not an employment contract.

title: Data Scientist
summary: We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team in NYC!  Company  Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions to empower the advertising industry to effectively influence consumers everywhere, on every device. We solve the most pressing problems for brands, agencies, publishers, and technology companies by verifying that every impression has the opportunity to be effective, optimizing towards opportunities to consistently improve results, and analyzing digital’s impact on consumer actions. Built on data science and engineering, IAS is headquartered in New York with global operations in ten countries. Our growth and innovation have been recognized in Inc. 500, Crain’s Fast 50, Forbes America’s Most Promising Companies, and I-COM’s Smart Data Marketing Technology Company. IAS was also named to Crain’s Best Places to Work in NYC for four years running, Great Companies to Work For in NYS, and AdAge's list of Best Places to Work in the US.  Team  The Data Science team at Integral is a high profile team that is a center of innovation for the company and a major contributor to the company’s core products. The types of challenges we solve have attracted people from industry and academia with diverse backgrounds, ranging from machine learning, physics, biology, neuroscience, and computer science to finance and economics. We’re passionate about maintaining an open and collaborative environment, where team members bring their own unique style of thinking and tools to the table.  Role  As a member of the Data Science team you will be solving complex problems across a wide range of areas related to brand safety, causality, marketing attribution, ad viewability, online fraud detection, video and contextual classification, all while helping us build and scale the next generation of our data science research and development platform.  Responsibilities:  Work on challenging fundamental data science problems in online advertising Measurably impact business KPIs by delivering high-quality scalable solutions Discover actionable insights from data and present them through rich visualizations Partner with product and engineering teams and work closely with other teams Propose and develop solutions independently and in collaboration with others Write high-quality efficient code while implementing your own ideas Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources Assemble data sets from multi-terabyte structured and unstructured data repositories Work on formulation, implementation, testing and validation of predictive models Develop and follow best practices for data analysis, instrumentation, and experimentation  Qualifications:  Advanced degree in a relevant technical field (machine learning, computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, or related field), or 2+ years’ experience in a relevant role Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources A strong passion for empirical research and for answering difficult questions with data Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches based on machine learning methods, including (but not only) text classification and natural language processing. Fluency with at least one scripting language such as Python Familiarity with relational databases and SQL Familiarity with an analysis tool such as R or Matlab Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Pig, HBase, etc.) Experience with at least some of the following machine learning libraries: scikit-learn, H2O, SparkML, TensorFlow, etc  Learn more about us by visiting: http://bit.ly/glassdoorIAS ( http://bit.ly/glassdoorIAS ) or www.integralads.com ( http://www.integralads.com/ ).  Equal Opportunity Employer: IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.  Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com ( recruitingagencies@integralads.com ). We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

title: Research Analyst
summary: Our vision is to bring more innovation, efficiency, and equality of opportunity by helping create an open financial system for the world. We are focused on making digital currency accessible to everyone and are guided by two key principles: be the most trusted company in our industry and create products that are easy to use.   GDAX plays a critical role in achieving that vision. As public blockchains create an open financial system for the world, sophisticated traders will need a place to discover, access, and exchange digital assets. We are focused on building the most trusted and secure digital asset exchange for institutions and professional traders. These traders will bring important liquidity to the industry, providing improved price stability and enabling more people to participate in an open financial system.   This is where you come in — we are looking for someone to establish GDAX as the premier destination for market data, research, and analysis of digital assets. You will work closely with our Sales, Success, and Trading teams, publishing qualitative and quantitative content prepared specifically for our institutional clients. If you’re excited about researching a new asset class and helping bring it to the financial world, this is the right team for you.   A little about us: we are a cross-functional, product-driven team dedicated to building the premier digital asset exchange in the world. We value positive energy, continuous learning, and clear communication and are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment for people from all backgrounds.   Responsibilities :  Establish GDAX as the premier source for digital asset market data, research, and analysis Create products such as weekly market analyses, monthly research reports, and quarterly industry overviews Establish and grow a dedicated subscriber base Requirements :  4+ years of experience in either a sell-side or buy-side research role Experience covering the FX, commodity, rates, or global emerging markets Strong data analysis, strategic thinking, and written communication skills Basic knowledge of the digital asset market, such as bitcoin, litecoin, and ether Degree in math, economics, or engineering preferred What to send  Resume or LinkedIn profile A response to the following prompt: “Prepare a one page market analysis on bitcoin, ether, or litecoin based on recent market data. Please include qualitative and quantitative components in your analysis.”

title: Data Reporting Analyst
summary: Malin is looking for a Data Reporting Analyst to assist our Information Systems department in compiling, interpreting and reconciling key business, financial, operational and statistical data. This vital information will be used by leadership, and internal and external customers to look at certain business trends to prioritize business and information needs.  The successful candidate will have: 2-4 years in a similar role as a Data Analyst  Advanced level -- SSRS and Excel  Intermediate level -- SQL writing  SSAS and SSIS knowledge preferred  Power BI experience preferred  Strong analytical, research and problem solving skills  Strong written and verbal skills  Ability to work independently, as well as a strong team environment  Ability to effectively manage time  Ability to project high degree of self-confidence and a positive attitude  Malin is an Equal Opportunity Employer -- M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Data Scientist
summary: Quartz seeks a data scientist to help us improve with data. This position will lead data collection and analysis for all of our products, helping the product and editorial teams make better-informed decisions and optimize their efforts to serve and grow Quartz’s audience.  We have a diverse array of products with rich usage data and interesting challenges: QZ.com, our flagship website; the Quartz Daily Brief and four other popular emails; apps for iOS and Android; Atlas, a user-generated charted platform; and more. These are created by a talented group of designers, engineers, and product managers with whom you would work every day. And you would do it all within a forward-thinking newsroom that puts its users first and foremost.  The responsibilities of this job include: analyzing key questions about our products and their users;  knowing the questions we should be asking of our data;  implementing a variety of algorithms (e.g. supervised and unsupervised machine learning, Bayesian MCMC) to support important product decisions  developing models for data collection in our products;  proactively studying our data for new insights  Yes, it’s a big job! And it’s a new role for us, though you won’t be on your own in working with data at Quartz. You would be joining our analytics team, which consists of several analysts, data engineers, and a product scientist. And we have robust tracking on most of our existing products, which means you’d have rich data with which to work on day one.  To be successful in this job, you will of course need experience as a data scientist, product analyst, or something similar. And we also expect you will bring technical skills to the role: proficiency with big data cloud solutions and open source analytic tools. Experience with Python (Pandas and Scikit-Learn) is preferred, though we don’t insist on a particular language. It’s important that you can analyze and visualize data on your own.  Previous experience in media isn’t crucial, but it could definitely help. Regardless, you should have a strong interest in Quartz’s work and the many ways in which digital journalism products are different from other kinds of products. Most importantly, you should be a voice for the value of data and importance of rigorous analysis in a newsroom environment.  This job reports to the director of analytics. Candidates who can work in our New York office are strongly preferred, since our entire product team is located there, but we’ll consider applications from other locations. Please include with your application a cover letter and, if at all possible, a sample of your work in data science (github repo, a report, or other indication of what you can do).  Atlantic Media Values: Across Atlantic Media, generally, the firm looks for two “pillar gifts” in its candidates. In all of us, these are more aspirational than actual, but they are central in our intentions.  Force of Intellect - Atlantic Media seeks a discipline and rigor of thought as manifested, often, in exceptional academic performance and, later, success in a professional environment.  Spirit of Generosity - Equally, Atlantic Media seeks what we term a spirit of generosity – a natural disposition towards service and selfless conduct.  Atlantic Media is an EOE of Minorities/Women/Vets/Disability.

title: Data Analyst
summary: DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change.
