title: Analyst
summary: Since the App Store launched nine years ago, millions of apps have been downloaded billions of times while more than $70B has been paid out to developers, making it the most successful place to discover amazing and innovative apps from developers.  In September, we redesigned the App Store from the ground up, adding original stories and editorial to make discovering apps and games easier than ever before. At Apple, Analytics is a key driver in making strategic decisions like the App Store redesign. We're looking for talented, passionate and results-oriented individuals to join our team and develop new insights to shape the future of the App Store for years to come.  The App Store Analytics team analyzes large-scale data across customer and developer touch points in order to develop metrics and deep insights to measure performance and drive strategy. Our culture is about getting things done iteratively and rapidly, with open feedback and debate along the way; we believe analytics is a team sport. We encourage independent decision-making and taking smart risks.  The App Store Analytics team collaborates deeply with stakeholders across product and design, engineering, and business teams: our mission is to drive innovation at Apple through deep quantitive research.  Further reading: The App Store ( https://www.apple.com/ios/app-store/) Introducing the New App Store ( https://developer.apple.com/videos/play/wwdc2017/301/) Apple unveils all-new App Store ( https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2017/06/apple-unveils-all-new-app-store/) Developer earnings from the App Store top $70 billion ( https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2017/06/developer-earnings-from-the-app-store-top-70-billion/) Key Qualifications 4-7 years of recent experience in a business analyst role. Preferably experience in the app industry or related field. Familiarity with measuring UX, customer engagement, planning and analyzing AB experiments. A passion for improving the customer experience through refining the product. Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills, with strong attention to detail. Strong business mindset, possessing an ability to condense complex analysis and technical concepts into clear and concise takeaways for business leaders. Ability to operate comfortably and effectively in a fast paced, highly cross-functional, rapidly changing environment. Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage work to tight deadlines and handle the pressure of product launches and executive requests. Well-versed in SQL languages. Experience with big data frameworks preferred. Ability to comprehensively understand data elements, sources and relationships in business and technical terms. Strong familiarity with multiple platforms, tools, methodologies in data analysis and insight synthesis. Description Dive deep into the large-scale data to identify key insights that will inform product improvements and business strategy. Define how best to measure and monitor our products and their features. Engage with the business, engineering, product management teams as a thought partner. Build and maintain strong partnerships with key stakeholders across the company in order to successfully deliver actionable insights Partner with other Apple organizations on data gathering, data governance, democratizing data with reporting tools and evangelizing KPI’s. Education Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Computer Science, CIS/MIS, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or relevant field. Ideally, Masters in related field.

title: User Studies / Data Analytics Scientist
summary: The iOS International keyboard and text team is looking for an elite Human Factors engineer to join our efforts in providing the best typing experience possible. The iPhone and iPad keyboards have revolutionized the way mankind communicates with one another by enabling billions of messages to be sent per day; they have literally transformed how we all communicate everyday. That makes the Keyboard and other text input modalities among the top features used on iOS devices. This is a high visibility, high impact position that requires a breadth of knowledge and deep understanding of how we, as humans, interact with our devices for communication and text input. Key Qualifications 5 years of experience in Human Factors based design and testing A demonstrated passion for observing, measuring, and improving Human-Computer Interfaces - especially in the areas of human communication and text input. A proven passion and leadership in user study design and execution with excellent knowledge of statistics as applied to study design and data analysis is required. Deep experience developing GUIs and automated data collection/processing tools for Mac and iOS environments using Matlab, JMP, R, Swift, C, Objective-C, HTML, Python, etc. preferred. Experience with human subject studies using motion capture (Vicon or similar), EMG, video and acoustic data collection, eye-tracking, EEG, is highly desired. Working knowledge of sensory physiology, anthropometry, hand biomechanics and mechanical design is preferred. Description This position will be responsible for the development of user study tools and the design and execution of user studies related to text input, in collaboration with many cross-functional teams across Apple. The role requires the creation and utilization of new software tools and analysis techniques for assessment of performance and preference as users interact with Apple products - especially on-screen keyboards and other methods for delivering text input. Responsibilities will also include the collection, processing, and presentation of study data using custom built tools and providing statistically sound and actionable recommendations to the relevant design teams to improve the users’ text input experience. Education Masters Degree

title: Data Engineer, Analytics (WhatsApp)
summary: (Menlo Park, CA) WhatsApp is a fast, simple and reliable way to talk to anyone in the world. More than 1 billion people in over 180 countries use WhatsApp to stay in touch with friends and family, anytime and anywhere. WhatsApp is not only free but also available on multiple mobile devices and in low connectivity areas — making it accessible and reliable wherever you are. It's a simple and secure way to share your favorite moments, send important information or catch up with a friend. WhatsApp helps people connect and share no matter where they are in the world.    We are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join the WhatsApp Business and Analytics Team. In this role, you will see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. You will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll get an opportunity to solve some of the most challenging business problems on the web and mobile Internet, at a scale that few companies can match.    In addition, you must have the ability to operate independently in a fast-paced, small but growing environment and work proactively with various teams across the organization, including Engineering, Product, Business, Customer Support, Human Resources, Finance and Legal. This is a full-time position based with the WhatsApp team at Facebook HQ in Menlo Park, California and will report to WhatsApp’s Head of Growth & Partnerships. Responsibilities Manage data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products. Interface with engineers, product managers and product analysts to understand data needs. Build data expertise and own data quality for allocated areas of ownership. Design, build and launch new data models in production. Design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production. Support existing processes running in production. Define and manage SLA for all data sets in allocated areas of ownership. Work with data infrastructure to triage infra issues and drive to resolution. Minimum Qualifications BS/BA in Technical Field, Computer Science or Mathematics. 2+ years experience in the data warehouse space. 2+ years experience in custom ETL design, implementation and maintenance. 2+ years experience working with either a Map Reduce or an MPP system. 2+ years experience with object-oriented programming languages 2+ years experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling. 2+ years experience in writing SQL statements. Ability to analyze data to identify deliverables, gaps and inconsistencies. Communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights. Ability in managing and communicating data warehouse plans to internal clients. Preferred Qualifications Experience with Python or Java

Cinch is an insurance startup based in Boston, MA focused on leveraging technology to make insurance simple and affordable for professionals and small businesses, looking to grow our team. If you constantly strive for excellence, and want to work with a collaborative, fast paced and energetic team - then Cinch is for you. Design, build and launch new data models in production. Design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production. Ability to analyze data to identify deliverables, gaps and inconsistencies. Ability in managing and communicating data warehouse plans to internal clients Preferred Qualifications BS/BA in Technical Field, Computer Science or Mathematics. Knowledge in Python or Java

title: Data Visualization Consultant
summary: Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology, and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together.  Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 4,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2016 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 25 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada.  Job Title: Data Visualization Consultant  Data visualization is the art of conveying insights in an intuitive and compelling way to drive understanding and decision making from key executives on down to operational analysts. You will operate at the intersection of business, analytics, and design. You will design, development, and implementation of these visual solutions for Slalom Consulting’s clients.  Responsibilities  You will be responsible for the design and development of compelling data visualizations via a variety of techniques including data storytelling, Gestalt principles, and user-centric design. Build tailored Tableau, Wave, and/or Looker visualizations and define required supporting data architecture (e.g., data marts). Collaborate with both business and IT partners to identify key use cases and define associated requirements. Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective and sustainable solutions to clients. Lead and mentor data visualization developers in information presentation and delivery.  Required Skills and Experience  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent professional experience. Five years of progressive post-baccalaureate experience in the field of Business Intelligence or Information Management. Two plus years of hands-on expertise with at least one enterprise Business Intelligence tool (e.g., Tableau, QlikView, MicroStrategy, Wave, Looker, etc.) Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities. Strong written/oral communication and presentation/interpersonal skills. Highly motivated and able to work independently as well as in a team environment.  Preferred experience also includes: Demonstrable proficiency with multiple enterprise Business Intelligence tools Advanced knowledge of SQL, including the ability to write stored procedures, triggers, analytic/windowing functions, and tuning. Knowledge of relational and dimensional database structures, theories, and practices.  Slalom Is An Equal Opportunity Employer And All Qualified Applicants Will Receive Consideration For Employment Without Regard To Race, Color, Religion, Sex, National Origin, Disability Status, Protected Veteran Status, Or Any Other Characteristic Protected By Law.

title: Analyst
summary: Overview Fuel your intellectual curiosity and professional growth. Forrester is an idea company, where smart, motivated, curious people bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on ideas that change the course of business. Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change.  About This Role:  The Analyst conducts innovative research and delivers advice through written reports, consulting, client inquiries, and speeches. This analyst will be part of our digital Business and channel strategy research team, which serves professionals who are responsible for the success of their firms’ digital business and distribution channel strategies.  The successful candidate will research, write for, present to, and advise digital business and channel strategy professionals in the retail and branded manufacturer space to guide their direct-to-consumer strategies. This analyst will work closely with a senior-level analyst on the team for day to day guidance on learning the analyst craft and to jointly research and deliver a body of research. Candidates will need a strong understanding of the business and technology issues facing digital business executives today, and must have an appetite for conducting and writing research to stay abreast of the issues. Responsibilities Develop a deep understanding of what Forrester clients require to be successful as digital business and channel strategy professionals. Conduct primary and secondary research and collaborate with fellow research analysts on all aspects of the responsibilities of digital business and channel strategy professionals at retail and branded manufacturer companies, including aspects of commerce technology and omnichannel retailing overall. Find and analyze data from Forrester and external (e.g. government, public filing, etc.) sources. Help define the future of direct-to-consumer digital commerce strategies by using research to paint an accurate, forward-looking picture about the impact of emerging technologies. As part of the broader digital commerce research plan, write six long research documents per year that convey new ideas in a rich business context. These reports typically: 1) introduce new thinking about successful business and technology strategies; 2) compare new technologies or services and their potential to help clients solve their business challenges; or 3) size emerging business opportunities in the retail and branded manufacturer sector. Write eight short research documents per year on digital issues facing retailers and branded manufacturers, in coordination with eBusiness and channel strategy analysts and in the context of the overarching digital commerce research plan. Consult with clients to apply Forrester’s research in the context of their specific business environment and help solve their problems. Present at select Forrester-sponsored conferences and briefings, and deliver client webinars. Start to establish an industry presence as an influential speaker and thinker. Build relationships with senior digital business and channel strategy professionals at retail and branded manufacturer companies, as well as with the technology vendors that serve them and the journalists who cover the sector. Qualifications A minimum of three years of experience in positions of increasing responsibility working in client-facing primary research or management consulting. A strong record of academic achievement: a B.A. or B.S. at minimum. Deep intellectual curiosity about the impact of technology on the retail industry. Demonstrated experience in conducting primary and secondary research, including strong interview skills and a facility with finding and analyzing data from Forrester and external sources. Demonstrated experience in successfully collaborating with colleagues, clients, and/or technology partners. Superior collaboration skills, as well as demonstrated resourcefulness in understanding the existing body of Forrester research and data and how new research ties into that. Superior listening, critical thinking, and writing skills, as well as authoritative presentation skills. Analysts are expected to take complex, disparate ideas and distill them into simple, provocative concepts — and be willing to take a stand on technologies, trends and outcomes. The ability to travel 25% of the time.  FLSA Status: Exempt  Forrester Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity for all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, genetic information, military service, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Minorities, Women, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans are especially encouraged to apply.  Data Protection The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities. By submitting your resume/CV, you consent to Forrester’s retention of the information provided on a secure file for personnel administration and management purposes and/or in order to consider you for future employment opportunities and to the transfer of the information provided to: Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.

title: Analyst, Social and Web Analytics
summary: Analyst, Social and Web Analytics   Overview:   The Analyst, Social and Web Analytics provides in-depth analyses and reporting to the Social Content and Strategy team and the Snapchat team. The Analyst will be responsible for providing the necessary support for insight-based editorial and business decisions, both strategic and tactical, while serving as the analytic subject matter expert to various levels of business stakeholders. The ideal candidate is someone who is highly quantitative, nimble and creative; immersed in the latest social media trends and platforms; and has the ability to think critically and incorporate data and testing into the decision-making process. Expertise with digital analytic tools is a must but we are also looking for people who are curious, motivated and entrepreneurial.   Primary Responsibilities:  • Work closely with digital leadership to determine and meet growth and engagement goals  • Provide social data, traffic reporting and audience insights on an ongoing basis to the Social Content and Strategy team  • Support the Snapchat team in understanding the performance of Discover editions and optimizing them  • Measure and benchmark the success of native social assets and on-site trending content  • Uncover and interpret patterns and trends in user behavior across Conde Nast websites and social pages to drive content ideation and optimize output  • Devise and track testing strategies for optimizing social content and the social feed  • Develop and implement social listening strategies and reporting templates for trending topics  • Collaborate with brand-dedicated analysts to track key metrics across the business for easy executive reference and decision-making  • Identify new tools and processes that the Social Content and Strategy team and Conde Nast brands can use to gain better insight into social performance and trends  Required Skills:  • 1-3 years of experience with a major website, social platform, digital advertising agency or online marketing, advertising, publishing, fashion or retail organization with a thorough understanding of online business models and strategies  • Experience with reporting and analysis using a major web analytics tool such as Omniture / Google Analytics, as well as social analytics tools – native (e.g. Facebook Insights) or third-party (e.g. Crowd Tangle)  • Entrepreneurial, digitally savvy, creative and experimental in the approach to problem solving, with exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills  • Ability to clearly articulate and present initiatives to creative and technical teams alike  • Understanding of statistical concepts  • Ability to effectively communicate data with actionable recommendations

title: Nike Digital Product Manager/Data Analyst Intern - New York
summary: ABOUT s23NYC Tucked in the heart of New York’s iconic Flatiron District, s23NYC is a team of marketers, designers, and engineers focused on reimagining how Nike’s most dedicated fans unlock, discover, and think about their kicks. s23NYC is Nike’s first digital experience studio and the driving force behind some of the brand’s most memorable moments. The Product Management/Data Analyst Intern will partner with stakeholders to gather product definition, produce business cases, prioritize work and ensure stakeholder alignment. The successful candidate will create detailed product requirements and work closely with Consumer Knowledge, Product Marketing, Design, Engineering, Program Management and stakeholder teams to build and deliver the product. Key Responsibilities: Participate in the development of product strategy and concepts for key products and services, against a specific market/business segment Develop business cases by assessing the available data to produce expected outcome models; use this analysis to inform priorities Communicate and align product strategy, roadmap and priorities with key internal and external stakeholders Work closely with app and platform engineering teams, design, and program management to deliver products and services to market Conduct detailed competitive and experimental analysis Develop strong hypotheses, independently solve problems, and share game-changing insights to drive growth Currently pursuing an MBA, advanced degree, or other professional specialization with an expected graduation date of Spring 2019 Preferred course of study: business, economics, applied math, statistics, engineering, data science, or other quantitative field Minimum two (2) years’ experience using data to facilitate business decisions High attention to detail including the ability to analyze data, produce expected outcome models, to perform competitive analyses, to document requirements and to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously Proficiency with SQL and experience with one additional scripting language (Python preferred) Superior verbal and written communications skills Ability to work in a fast-paced, startup environment where continuous innovation is a way of life Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills, to back up assumptions and develop business cases Demonstrated ability to dive deep in understanding the product, our consumer, our business, and the competitive landscape Proactive, solutions-orientation with a passion for solving unique, complex problems that have a broad, inter-connected impact on the business Applications due by February 12, 2017 UR ID: 46837619

title: Data Analyst

Requires manual dexterity to use computer, telephone and peripherals May be required to work extended hours for special business needs May be required to travel on rare occasion based on business needs Minimum Education:  Minimum BA or BS in a relevant field including Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or equivalent Minimum Related Work Experience:  Minimum 3-5 year’s equivalent work experience using SQL (medium to advanced). Experience with OLAP and data warehousing a plus. Working knowledge of Redshift, PostgreSQL, HP Vertica, MS Office, Alteryx, Talend. Experience developing, deploying and documenting ETL processes. title: Quantitative Product Analyst
summary: DO YOU WANT TO… Learn how technology start-ups work? Join a rapidly growing company? Make an immediate impact? Analyze and solve problems with BIG data? Quantify consumer behavior? Learn how A/B testing & online advertising work? Define your work environment? Bring enthusiasm to your work and have fun? title: Junior Business Operations Data Analyst
summary: OpticsPlanet, Inc has an exciting entry level opportunity for a Junior Business Operations Data Analyst. This is an excellent chance to learn cutting-edge ecommerce business practices, and feel the heartbeat of one of the world's largest and most data-driven online retailers, by analyzing operational and financial performance of the company.   In this role, you will see a direct link between your work and company growth. The role will be responsible for developing operational targets, KPIs, and revenue forecasts for a variety of business units and teams. The role is highly cross-functional and will include communication with many departments such as Supply Chain Management, Marketing, Operations, and others. This role conducts a wide range of business analysis, defines and communicates the appropriate metrics that are needed to accurately and objectively measure business performance. Role activities may include interpreting financial trends, identifying operational deviations from expected performance and reporting results to various departments within the organization. This role will challenge the candidate to understand and contribute to many facets of the company including business analytics, risk and revenue forecasting, data management, and executive reporting.   Primary Duties and Responsibilities Applying knowledge in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers. Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics. Performing statistical analyses on large data sets to provide actionable insights to operations and product teams. Analyzing current business performance and building statistical models to extrapolate current trends into forward-looking forecasts. Conducting cost-benefit analysis for various initiatives considered by the company Developing methods to analyze market trends, pricing, product offerings and customer experiences. Reconciling differences and inconsistencies in the financial and operational data within the various corporate systems. Researching, analyzing, and explaining current and past activity, expected trends, and potential effect of the change made. Presenting and supporting findings and recommendations to various management levels within the organization. Additional duties as requested by management Qualifications, Skills, and Requirements The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated interest in data and technology, will be quick on the uptake, and highly analytical. BA/BS in Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, or other technical field is preferred. Good understanding of SQL. Advanced MS Excel Skills. Experience solving analytical problem using statistical / quantitative approaches. Some programming experience is a plus (PHP, C++, Javascript, VBA, or others). Experience with Microsoft BI tools is a plus.

title: Data Scientist
summary: Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smarts, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play. SUMMARY At Hulu, number one priority is our customers. We make business decisions around our customers’ preferences. Data Sciences Team at Hulu combines deep data analysis and research of our rich user data to present a compelling vision around user retention and preferences across the vast ecosystem of Hulu’s product offerings and content. We are looking for data scientists who are passionate about using data to drive strategy and product recommendations. You will be engaged with senior leaders to design well-constructed analyses and work cross-functionally with analysts, product managers and engineers to effectively deliver actionable results. You will work on variety of domains such as data science, machine learning and optimization; lead cutting edge analytical solution development pipeline and contribute to external research via attending conferences and collaborations. WHAT YOU’LL DO Apply state of the art machine learning, statistics or data mining in a variety of areas, including customer analysis, video content genome, social analysis, etc. Invent and fast iterate on novel solutions to challenging data related problems. Develop scalable and efficient methods for large scale data analyses and model development. Collaborate with developers, program managers, and product managers in an open, creative environment. Coaching and providing research and system guidance to a team of other researchers on a variety of areas including video content genome, social mining, data analysis, etc. WHAT TO BRING Master's degree in MS in Statistics or related quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research). 3+ years related experience such as analyzing data and/or building analytical models; in either an academic or professional setting and 3+ years relevant work experience. Experienced with scripting languages such as R, Python, Ruby or SAS. Real world analytical solution building experience. Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions. Demonstrated self-direction. Proficient in prototyping models using scripting languages (e.g. Python, Ruby, etc.). NICE-TO-HAVES PhD in in Statistics or related quantitative field (e.g. Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research). Experience in causal inference is a plus.  We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local laws.  LI-SY1

Ability to facilitate meetings, conduct training and informational sessions. Ability to communicate effectively: build consensus, facilitate working sessions, and negotiate solutions and alternatives. Ability to prepare detailed documentation. Ability to analyze instructions, processes, systems and data. Ability to maintain records, prepare reports, and conduct correspondence related to the work. Ability to maintain favorable public relations and perform problem/issue resolution. Ability to set priorities and work with a team. Able to work additional hours as needed on large projects Able to hear oral communication either in person or on equipment such as telephone or mobile phone. Must demonstrate commitment to compliance with applicable laws and regulations, the Company's Ethics and Compliance Code, and other Company policies and procedures, and take all required training courses. Must demonstrate respect for all individuals and adhere to the Company's values and business practices Able to travel as needed by car or plane  Working Conditions:  Able to function successfully in environment with moderate pressure to meet deadlines. Able to work overtime, as required to meet established deadlines. Able to work indoors, in an office environment, regardless of whether cubicle, open office or private office. Able to travel occasionally to meetings or for training, occasionally overnight. Able to work overtime, as needed or required. title: Data Analyst - Tech Services
summary: About Uber We’re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.  For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer. And that’s just what we’re doing today. We’re thinking about the future, too.  With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we’re in for the long haul. We’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next. About the Role We are looking for an exceptional data analyst who lives and breathes data. Our mission is to empower Uber with actionable insights and solve problems with data tools, dashboarding, and analysis.  You will work closely with a team of engineers and build strong relationships with our internal customers. What You’ll DoCollaborate with different teams across the org to understand our environment and proactively find opportunities to better the businessWork from inception of a specified business problem to delivery of a solutionIdentify opportunities to fix or improve processes that make Uber better in the long termWork closely with your team to put together seemingly disparate pieces of data, build out the data warehouse and create interactive dashboardsEffectively communicate data methodology and results to a diverse set of stakeholders.Write queries, contribute to larger scale products/projects and perform ad hoc analyses as neededWhat You’ll NeedExcel guru; you can get your hands dirty when we do not yet have the right scalable solution in placeSQL expert and general understanding of databases, relationships and data integrity concepts. We use a number of technologies: MySQL, Postgres, Hive, Presto, Vertica2+ years experience with BI Tools such as Tableau or MicroStrategyData visualization best practicesStrong communication skills and customer empathy, capable of pushing for the best solution with tactSuperior attention to detail, team player, and organizationWillingness and desire to learn and grow – both technical and non-technical – in order to push the team and our customers to the next level3+ years experience in quantitative/analytic role, preferably within tech Bonus Points IfExperience with analytics focusing on internally-built and 3rd party toolsWeb analytics/experimentation experience is a plus, such as Google Analytics and A/B testing

title: Business Intelligence Analyst

title: Data Scientist - New College Grad
summary: Company Overview   At Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to:  Build and enhance our proven security platform Blend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architecture Analyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intel Collaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challenges We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.   The Role   Proofpoint is looking for an excellent Data Scientist to join the Threat Research & Engineering group. We analyze data on a massive scale in solutions that detect and stop cyber attacks against our customers. We are a fast-paced, high-energy group that is constantly seeking innovative ways to prevent the latest cyber threats quickly and automatically. This is an environment where you will be given the opportunity to make a real impact. The team has a highly collaborative culture that enjoys learning and solving big problems. We are looking for individuals that are as passionate as we are about building great software. Engineers on the team work up and down the software stack to tackle challenging issues of scale, reliability, security and usability for our customers.   Your day-to-day  Take end-to-end ownership of design and implementation of product features that will ship to customers Write efficient and maintainable code Be a great teammate and enjoy our fun-loving positive culture What you bring to the team  Strong coding & debugging skills in an object-oriented language (Java, Python, C++, Ruby, C#, Objective-C) Knowledge of big data processing and data analytics techniques a plus Experience with web application development a plus Have great communication skills and love to learn new things Why Proofpoint   As a customer focused and driven-to-win organization with leading edge products, there are many exciting reasons to join the Proofpoint team. We believe in hiring the best the brightest and cultivating a culture of collaboration and appreciation. As we continue to grow and expand globally, we understand that hiring the right people and treating them well is key to our success! We are a multi-national company with locations in 10 countries, with each location contributing to Proofpoint’s amazing culture!   #LI-DNP

title: Summer 2018 Data Analyst Intern
summary: Company Overview   The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America® (Guardian), currently ranked #218 on the Fortune 500, is one of the largest mutual life insurers. As of December 31, 2016, Guardian reports $1.5 billion in operating income, $7.4 billion in capital, and $66.5 billion in assets under management.  Guardian consistently scores high marks for financial strength from all four major credit rating agencies and enjoys a strong competitive position in its major businesses: life insurance, disability income insurance, annuities, investments, dental and vision insurance and employee benefits.   As a mutual company founded over 150 years ago, Guardian is owned by its policyholders. The company has paid dividends to policyholders every year since 1868 and the Company’s 8,800 employees and 2,750 financial representatives are aligned with its mission to help individuals, families, and small businesses achieve financial security and protection.   Guardian states its aspiration in the following way: “To be the trusted mutual partner, delivering financial security how, when, and where our clients prefer.”   Internship Overview   The Guardian Internship Program is a paid 10-week learning experience where you will be immersed in the daily environment of a thriving Fortune 500 global financial services company. We pride ourselves on a culture of respect, high standards, and fairness. Our aspirations include business growth, a refocus on the customer, teamwork and collaboration, and continuous improvement.   You will gain invaluable industry and organizational knowledge through daily business interactions and job assignments, in addition to engaging in projects that directly affect our business, interact with senior leaders in conversational settings, and network with employees and interns across our regional offices.   Role Description   The Technology Team offers a broad suite of services and delivers innovative solutions in support of Guardian’s growth strategy through infrastructure, applications, and information security used within the Guardian Home Office environment; as well as supporting our Agency employees with access to critical Guardian applications and the required support to facilitate a secure and optimal experience.   Opportunities in This Area Can Include, But are Not Limited to   · Application Development – builds new applications and provides application software development services or technical support for enterprise applications and business products. Develops program logic for new applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications. Responsible for planning, coding, testing, debugging, delivering, maintaining, and documenting home-grown or vendor-supported software services and applications.   · Data Analysis – analyzes, designs, creates and implements databases, including data models, logical and physical databases, data dictionaries and schemas, access methods, device allocations, validation checks, organization and security. Develops and implements database recovery plans and procedures.   · Data Science – responsible for managing advanced big data / analytics projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results, and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. This includes data mining, data auditing, aggregation, validation, and reconciliation.   · Database Administration – manages database utilities, monitors the relationships between the database users and applications, and maintains the organization's databases across multiple platforms and computing environments. Applies understanding of relational database concepts and query languages in order to design required summary or aggregation tables to support analyses.   · Information Security – evaluates, tests, recommends, develops, coordinates, monitors, and maintains information security (IS) policies, procedures and systems, including hardware, firmware and software. Ensures that IS architecture/designs, plans, controls, processes, standards, policies and procedures are aligned with IS standards and overall information security. Identifies security risks and exposures, determines the causes of security violations and suggests procedures to halt future incidents.   · Architecture - designs, innovates and develops IT architecture (integrated process, applications, data and technology) solutions to business problems in alignment with the enterprise architecture direction and standards. Performs technical planning, architecture development and modification of specifications.   · Change Management – responsible for planning and monitoring smaller scale change management projects and directing specific portions of larger scale projects. Possesses in depth knowledge of each line of business, in order to anticipate necessary changes in software applications and systems.   · Project Management – manages all aspects of a diverse IT project or multiple IT projects, typically involving multiple disciplines in the IT function and composed of various levels of personnel, vendors, and clients. Secures required resources, and uses formal processes and tools to develop scope, manage resources, budgets, risks, quality and changes. Manages projects to ensure on-time completion according to specifications and within budgeted costs.   · Quality Assurance and Testing – conducts a wide range of quality control tests and analyses to ensure that software meets or exceeds specified standards and end-user requirements. Drafts, revises and approves test plans and scripts to ensure alignment with standards and IT strategy. Creates test data files with valid and invalid records to thoroughly test program logic and verify system flow.   · Vendor Management – negotiates favorable terms and contracts with suppliers or vendors, and prepares and processes requisitions, RFP's and purchase orders for the procurement of hardware, software and/or technology services. Establishes and implements acquisition, protection, maintenance and retention policies, standards and procedures that are aligned with IT standards and strategy.   · Network Engineering – provides technical expertise in the management of a public and/or private network; tests and analyzes network facilities, including network control software, routers, switches, lines, modems, adapters and servers. Installs, supports and/or maintains local (LAN) and/or wide area networks (WAN); evaluates and recommends networking product and software upgrades.   · Systems Administration – provides systems administration (e.g., adds, changes, deletes, disk space management, backups, etc.) and operational support (e.g., hardware/software installation, maintenance and support, systems logs and problems reports, etc.) for the organization's information systems and peripheral equipment, such as servers, desktops, printers and storage devices. Performs recovery procedures, scheduling and backups, and monitors batch processes.   · Systems Analysis – acts as a liaison between the IT development group and business units for the development and implementation of new systems and enhancement of existing systems. Evaluates new applications and identifies systems requirements. Evaluates new IT developments and evolving business requirements, and recommends appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems.   · Telecommunications – plans, designs, and implements voice and/or telecommunications networks. Performs technical analysis of software, hardware and transmission systems.   · Web Administration – plans and manages web systems and operating system server software, including web server setup and implementation. Maintains and monitors website functionality (e.g., links, calculators, news feeds) and website security. Conducts performance monitoring, capacity planning, workload modeling, and predictive analyses to identify and resolve potential issues (e.g., performance, security breaches).   · Workplace Support - provides onsite technical support to the organization's internal users of computer applications and hardware (e.g., PCs, servers, mainframes). Collaborates with network services, software systems engineering and/or application development in order to restore service and/or identify problems.   Qualifications  Education Requirements  Enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree Program Sophomore or Junior in College Degree Programs May Include the Following  Computer Science Computer Programming IT Security Computer Information Systems

title: BI Analyst
summary: SundaySky has a unique and exciting opportunity to join an analytics group for a rapidly growing startup. Our product combines digital technology, advertising, consumer relationship management, and big data for the most recognizable brand names across multiple industries. We are seeking an energetic, self-starter that combines an analytical mind with creative problem-solving skills to use data to drive success. The ideal candidate approaches analysis as a path to strategic thinking that culminates in actionable insights. If you're the kind of person who obsesses over details, thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced collaborative startup environment, wants an opportunity to make a significant impact and jumps at the opportunity to take on new challenges, SundaySky is the place for you.   In a fast paced, ever-changing environment, you will be involved in the following –  Building proactive analysis through data mining to identify trends and opportunities for product optimization. Finding areas of opportunity to drive revenue in a digital advertising campaign. Proving value to strategic clients by developing data-driven stories in dynamic presentations. Discovering best practices to reduce subjectivity, display industry leadership, and further develop our product. Developing a reporting platform to provide a unified view of results through dashboards and reports that will be accessed by all levels within SundaySky. Maintaining data integrity working closely with R&D to organize and store data in a format that provides accurate data and allows the business to quickly identify both data and operational issues. Packaging and presenting analytical findings and clearly communicating (both written and verbal) program results and complex concepts to success managers, marketing, sales team, and the end client in both statistical and non-statistical terms. Supporting sales and success management teams by providing data-driven industry overviews, information on research products, assisting with trouble-shooting issues, and answering questions that may arise from data issues and reports. Become an expert in industry, customer and SundaySky measurement methodologies.  The ideal candidate will have the following experience and skillset:  Minimum 3 years of experience in business analytics or digital advertising environment - A must Competency in statistical analytic techniques such as: time series data analysis, forecasting segmentation, univariate & multivariate statistical analysis, various metrics and key performance indicators, research & test design, significance testing, hypothesis testing, variance and growth calculations, return on investment Project management skills, including the abilities to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and work effectively with colleagues and clients in diverse departments, geographic locations, and time zones. Balances desire for quantitative rigor with realities of inconsistent business data Critical thinking: capable of generating consistently accurate, useful reports as well as enthusiasm for translating data into actionable insight relevant to marketing program objectives Experience with the following tools: MS Office: Advanced Excel (Pivot tables, advanced macros, etc.) and PowerPoint BI & Analytics Tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, SAS) Web analytics tools: Google Analytics, Omniture, DART, Coremetrics, etc. Open source statistical software: R or Python (similar to SAS, SPSS, etc.) Database (SQL, MySQL, NoSQL, Splunk, etc.) Experience with data visualization and/or an eye for design Proactive, independent thinker with high energy and positive attitude Bachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.Sc.) or equivalent. Experience with ecommerce / digital advertising best practices Willingness to take coaching for continuous personal development Experience working with a distributed team of Sales managers, project managers and technical support. Must be authorized to work in the US

company: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey
title: Business Intelligence Analyst
summary: For almost twenty years, our physicians, nurses, and staff have worked together toward the common goal of helping our patients become parents. RMA of New Jersey, one of the top fertility practices in the United States, continually seeks experienced, compassionate, and dynamic team players who are committed to delivering the ultimate patient experience.  Are you passionate about analyzing information and trends? Are you a hands-on technologist interested in how data can transform into intelligence? If you are an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst and are ready to join our growing practice, we want to talk to you! This is your opportunity to work for a world-renowned organization that offers stimulation, challenge and personal reward. You will work in a fast-paced, professional environment where your talent will contribute to changing people’s lives.  The Business Intelligence Analyst is a full time position based in our Basking Ridge, NJ office. Hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00AM to 4:30 PM.  How You'll Contribute: In general, the Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for developing BI solutions in the form of reports and dashboards for the organization and providing data visualization and analysis.  An ideal candidate will be a person that: Has experience working on Business Intelligence reports and analytics  Is familiar with modern Business Intelligence tools like Tableau; Alteryx; PowerBI or equivalents  Works with stakeholders at all levels to formulate requirements and then deliver against those  Has a keen interest in Visual Analytics  Is Inquisitive by nature and wants to learn more about a wide range of business challenges  Is a strong, clearer communicator as you will be working with peers across the globe  Responsibilities: Support the analysis, design, development and implementation of new reporting requirements  Evaluate and prioritize reported issues and communicate status and resolution to relevant users  Facilitate requirements gathering and specification development for BI projects  Fulfill ad-hoc reporting/data requests  Problem solve and offer ideas to solve client/customer issues  Identify efficiencies and innovative approaches to business processes  Maintain responsibility for completion and accuracy of BI solutions  BI platform maintenance  Degree in business, finance, or technology-related field  SQL Server, Alteryx, and Tableau knowledge is required  Technical or Senior Engineer experience is required. Data integration and BI project experience is a plus  Excellent trainer and oral and written communication skills are required.  Ability to effectively communicate processes and results with accuracy is also required.  Fluency in Spanish is a plus!

title: Analyst
summary: Dextera Corporation is a woman-owned, SBA Certified 8(a) company located in Centreville, Virginia. Dextera provides high-quality records management, administrative support and professional services to federal government customers.   POSITION SUMMARY   The analyst locates, accesses, evaluates, and synthesizes data from a variety of sources to prepare reports and spreadsheets that communicate management indicators and other information to administrators. The incumbent analyzes data to answer questions on agency policy, programs, and operations.   ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS   Use qualitative and quantitative research methods and appropriate data collection and data analyses to study and evaluate programs, services, and operations.  Gather, organize, evaluate, and synthesize information from a wide variety of sources, presented in various forms, and covering an array of topics, issues, problems, policies, processes, procedures, and practices.  Prepare reports that present management indicators, “dashboard-type” information, and other data drawn and synthesized from agency databased and information systems.  Create charts, graphs, tables, spreadsheets, and slide presentations to present data and communicate information based on analyses.  Make recommendations for improvements to customer service and public engagement programs, operations, systems, and reporting formats and recommend procedures to gain efficiencies in reporting processes.  Develop solutions to problems and enhancements to communication and reporting tools.  Compose, proofread, and/or edit written documents, such as analytical reports, briefing papers, and memos.  Use Microsoft Office software products (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Access).  Stay current in customer service and public engagement programs and initiatives, communications vehicles and tools, and computer-based information transmission systems and software.  Assist management with the development of correspondence, reports, charts, and presentations as requested. Assist in developing enhancements to USCIS communications tools and to customer service and public engagement systems and operations. Assist in the development of improvements to the USCIS website and customer access to information. Gather and organize information and perform data collection and analysis to study and evaluate program needs. JOB SPECIFICATIONS/QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor’s Degree with a minimum of five (5) years of experience in a management and/or program analyst or related role. Post-secondary education may be substituted for years of experience, and overall experience may be substituted for education requirement. Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint). Strong knowledge of computer-based system(s) that create, edit, manage, and transmit documents and text. Strong attention to detail, excellent organization skills, and ability to manage time effectively. Professional attitude and appearance, strong customer service orientation, and ability to maintain confidentiality. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to work cooperatively with a team, as well as independently with minimal supervision. Ability to prioritize and multi-task a high volume of work. Ability to occasionally work additional hours, if necessary, to meet client requirements.  OTHER REQUIREMENTS  The work is primarily sedentary, although some physical effort standing, walking, climbing stairs, bending, lifting, and carrying objects is required. The work is performed in an office setting that is adequately lighted and climate controlled. The incumbent must be able to secure and maintain a public trust clearance. Dextera Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. M/F/V/D/are encouraged to apply.

title: Analyst
summary: LongView International is seeking a creative, driven, team player to join the Executive Correspondence Team at a federal government client facility in Washington DC.   Duties:  Coordinate, respond, report, and track responses for various reports required by client organizations; in some cases this will require coordination with other divisions. Consult on data collection and analysis. Develop responses to inquiries from regulatory authorities.
